title: Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site.
resp:
[{"created": "2019-01-11T22:39:10.601358+00:00", "text": "These are all top-bottom approaches which are nice in paper. Actual and meaningful reforms won't come from the IMF or Pope Francis, they will come from grassroots movements, the 99%, working classes, oppressed minorities that organize, etc. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T22:39:10.601358+00:00", "id": "tqop2BXxEemGzWtmUNsjzw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/tqop2BXxEemGzWtmUNsjzw/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/tqop2BXxEemGzWtmUNsjzw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/tqop2BXxEemGzWtmUNsjzw"}, "user": "acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[9]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[9]", "endOffset": 343, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5880, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6223}, {"suffix": "


    
        
            
  ", "prefix": "hampered by inadequate revenue.
", "exact": "It is not just Pope Francis who has called for major reform of the economic system. The World Economic Forum, which met in January, advocated “fundamental reforms to market capitalism to tackle inequality”. In doing so, it echoed statements of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank, formerly strong advocates of the neoliberal agenda.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T22:35:57.058800+00:00", "text": "The left knelt to neoliberalism way before the crisis. Social democratic parties (the majority or the left) bought in the ideology and are now completely unable to regain its critical standpoint towards it. This is why it now goes on its knees together with neoliberalism. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T22:35:57.058800+00:00", "id": "Q1whyhXxEem-0RMx3goKtw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/Q1whyhXxEem-0RMx3goKtw/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Q1whyhXxEem-0RMx3goKtw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Q1whyhXxEem-0RMx3goKtw"}, "user": "acct:mateodededalmases@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 74, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4754, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4828}, {"suffix": ". It matters not whether we are ", "prefix": "      
        
        
    


", "exact": "And yet in 2017, just as neoliberalism is on its knees, so too is the left", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T06:18:49.360269+00:00", "text": "Economic liberalism is a system that allows for individualized economic decisions rather than those made by institutions and organizations. A liberal economy contributes to freedom, both political and civil. However, governments are blaming this liberal system as the reason for a global financial crisis. Do you think this is a fair view? ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T06:18:49.360269+00:00", "id": "woJrKBVoEemsFiOxHUF1Sw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:sophiet@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:sophiet@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:sophiet@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/woJrKBVoEemsFiOxHUF1Sw/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/woJrKBVoEemsFiOxHUF1Sw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/woJrKBVoEemsFiOxHUF1Sw"}, "user": "acct:sophiet@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[6]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1]", "startOffset": 108, "endContainer": "/div[6]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1]", "endOffset": 128, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3057, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3077}, {"suffix": " began to fall apart. The crisis", "prefix": "eans it’s almost a decade since ", "exact": "neoliberal economics", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T04:42:42.536692+00:00", "text": "I believe a leading reason behind the rise of right-wing forces in Europe and the United States is related to increasing waves of global immigration to the west inducing a strong sense of nationalism as well as the current refugee crisis. Additionally, this upsurge is not only a Western phenomenon, the rise of the far right and distinctive nationalism is occurring across the globe. America's 2016 election is supremely relevant, however recently elected Duterte in the Philippines and Bolsonaro in Brazil also come to mind. Marine Le Pen's fierce challenge in France is another notable case suggesting this may be a global trend. Within our borders one of the hotly debated elements of Justin Trudeau's political administration is their refugee policy.", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T04:42:42.536692+00:00", "id": "VU5qlhVbEempI8M4MHsW1w", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:sebastianmbarreto@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:sebastianmbarreto@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:sebastianmbarreto@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/VU5qlhVbEempI8M4MHsW1w/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/VU5qlhVbEempI8M4MHsW1w", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/VU5qlhVbEempI8M4MHsW1w"}, "user": "acct:sebastianmbarreto@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[28]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[28]", "endOffset": 135, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 12815, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 12950}, {"suffix": " This era is throwing up popular", "prefix": " and unprincipled conservatism.
", "exact": "The right’s capacity to jettison its principles, exploit racism and xenophobia, and to attack other minority groups, cannot be matched.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-10T06:06:12.632186+00:00", "text": "I think this is too idealistic. Yes it is in need of an overhaul, and yes, in reference to the above paragraph where financial crisis and climate change SHOULD have spawned a debate, it is nonetheless reality that these things have not happened. Fundamental societal issues along with political inefficiencies are the cause, and blaming one party is not the answer", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-10T06:06:12.632186+00:00", "id": "1QKbShSdEemv_dvoHGv0kw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1QKbShSdEemv_dvoHGv0kw/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/1QKbShSdEemv_dvoHGv0kw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/1QKbShSdEemv_dvoHGv0kw"}, "user": "acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[16]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[16]", "endOffset": 64, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8983, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 9047}, {"suffix": " When any system is gamed, the r", "prefix": "e. Photograph: Lukas Coch/AAP


", "exact": "Democracy and the institutions that support it need an overhaul.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-10T06:03:05.590091+00:00", "text": "What does the author suggest is the answer? I think it is one thing to criticize a free-market political system, and it is another to criticize and offer a solution that can realistically be applied", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-10T06:03:05.590091+00:00", "id": "ZaT-HhSdEemfR8vgL_DPlg", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/ZaT-HhSdEemfR8vgL_DPlg/www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/ZaT-HhSdEemfR8vgL_DPlg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/ZaT-HhSdEemfR8vgL_DPlg"}, "user": "acct:suzcmns432@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Just as neoliberalism is finally on its knees, so too is the left | Josh Bornstein"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/commentisfree/2017/feb/25/just-as-neoliberalism-is-finally-on-its-knees-so-too-is-the-left", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[12]", "startOffset": 133, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[12]", "endOffset": 165, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7603, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7635}, {"suffix": ". title: Alboim, Elly. 2011. On the verge of Total Dysfunction: Government, Media and Communications. How Canadians Communicate. David Taras and Christopher Waddell, Eds. Edmonton, AU Press. 45-54 (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site..
Davis, Aeron. 2010. Political Theory and Social Thought. London: Routledge. ETEXT. Chapter 1: In search of the ‘good democracy’. 1-17Links to an external site.
Davis, Aeron. Chapter 10: The ‘crisis” of politics and communication in aging democracies. 146-158.
Small, Tara et al. 2014. Chapter 1: The Triangulation of Canadian Political Communication. Political Communication in Canada: Meet the Press and Tweet the Rest. Vancouver, UBC Press.

Taras, David. 2012. “The Past and Future of Political Communication in Canada: An Introduction” in How Canadians Communicate IV: Media and Politics. David Taras and Christopher Waddell, Eds. AU Press: Edmonton. 1-24.
Sitaraman, Ganesh. 2018. The three crises of liberal democracy (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site., The Guardian.
resp:
[{"created": "2019-01-18T09:00:45.233359+00:00", "text": "It's a sad truth. Social media plays important role in disseminating the propaganda messages that can be poisonous for a society. As it says here, it can be used to expand the "reach of radical and fringe ideas and conspiracy theories", which consequently can lead to the serious issues.
", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-18T09:00:45.233359+00:00", "id": "ioCK9hr_EemofOsOkHooEA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:saniyaJ@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:saniyaJ@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:saniyaJ@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/ioCK9hr_EemofOsOkHooEA/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/ioCK9hr_EemofOsOkHooEA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/ioCK9hr_EemofOsOkHooEA"}, "user": "acct:saniyaJ@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "startOffset": 287, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "endOffset": 376, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5943, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6032}, {"suffix": "Growth has been stagnant for the", "prefix": "and opinions they want to hear. ", "exact": "This in turn has expanded the reach of radical and fringe ideas and conspiracy theories. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-17T08:06:18.635374+00:00", "text": "I'd argue that a significant part of the population would be really interested in this option. Based on the weak voting numbers we see every election and the relatively strong quality of life we have in Vancouver, it seems pretty clear to me that as long as people can find jobs and live indoors (even if it's crazy expensive and involves a long commute) they're happy to leave the government to sort itself out. 

If people had any vision for the future, the ones that do vote would probably stop voting Liberal or Conservative too, wouldn't they? Neither is accountable to the people except when they're pandering around election time and after that they basically do whatever they want. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-17T08:06:18.635374+00:00", "id": "xQ9oHBouEemh7vPav5yPIw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/xQ9oHBouEemh7vPav5yPIw/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/xQ9oHBouEemh7vPav5yPIw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/xQ9oHBouEemh7vPav5yPIw"}, "user": "acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[8]", "startOffset": 318, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[8]", "endOffset": 506, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 6669, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6857}, {"suffix": " Think of this as government by ", "prefix": "to these movements as populist. ", "exact": "At the same time, others flirt with what Mounk calls “undemocratic liberalism,” a style of governance which preserves rights but at the expense of democratic engagement and accountability.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-17T07:54:45.142437+00:00", "text": "Okay, so I can't say for sure, but I'd imagine if you spoke with these diverse communities they probably did not feel like they were part of a shared conversation. 

The gay community, for instance, probably didn't feel like a part of a shared conversation while they were fighting the status quo just to be accepted. And how about the "shared fact" that HIV was a gay problem and the ignorant mismanagement of that crisis in the media? 

I'd be surprised if black Americans, for most of the twentieth century and probably still today, felt like they were part of a shared conversation "based on shared facts." Especially during the months the black community of Montgomery spent boycotting transit so they could use the same seats as white people. 

I haven't read Mounk's book, but this premise is HUGELY problematic, especially in addition to the social homogeneity point later on. It kind of sounds like, and forgive me if I'm missing the point, that liberal democracy's three crises all involve the declining influence and power of one white, male, heterosexual perspective.

Yeah, liberal democracy is being seriously threatened (unless we argue that neoliberalism has entirely replaced it) but we can't start hearkening back to a socially homogeneous (that's code for white) time with a narrow choice of media viewpoints (also white).

All that being said, point two is valid. When productivity split from worker's wages in the second half of the 21st century economic inequality started down the path that lead to the significant wealth inequality we see today. That's a crisis of liberal democracy.", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-17T07:54:45.142437+00:00", "id": "J7hQrBotEemmMEdVCkMbWA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/J7hQrBotEemmMEdVCkMbWA/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/J7hQrBotEemmMEdVCkMbWA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/J7hQrBotEemmMEdVCkMbWA"}, "user": "acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 358, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 456, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4600, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4698}, {"suffix": " 
The second assumption was broa", "prefix": "remained within the mainstream. ", "exact": "This meant that even diverse communities were part of a shared conversation based on shared facts.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-17T07:30:59.037395+00:00", "text": "Sitaraman, and I suppose more accurately Mounk, is forgetting option 4: a communist people's revolution. It sounds crazy, but that's exactly what the peasants in the Russian Empire were saying to each other in 1916. So crazy, or just crazy enough to work?", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-17T07:30:59.037395+00:00", "id": "1atrbBopEemebKtjoNd-iw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1atrbBopEemebKtjoNd-iw/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/1atrbBopEemebKtjoNd-iw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/1atrbBopEemebKtjoNd-iw"}, "user": "acct:markjdunn@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[12]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[12]", "endOffset": 104, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8813, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8917}, {"suffix": " Economic reforms threaten the m", "prefix": "ople, rather than divides them.
", "exact": "All three parts of this agenda might seem uncomfortable to those who wish to continue politics as usual.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-15T08:16:37.175994+00:00", "text": "The reference to "tweet-storms" here in regards to politics demonstrates how much the political landscape has changed with the infiltration of digital media in our everyday lives. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T17:40:24.221718+00:00", "text": " This reminds me of issues surrounding converging media systems, in which large conglomerates will own many newspapers at the same time. The second assumption was broa", "prefix": " a shared conversation based on ", "exact": "shared facts.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T17:39:08.229163+00:00", "text": "I find this statement interesting because it is true to an extent. For platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and more, you may say and share what you want but there are regulations. If the shared content does not uphold the values of the platform there could be push back. For example on Twitter, during the elections in the United States, discourse regarding support and criticisms of certain political groups were deleted. People were experiencing their tweets being deleted and or accounts being suspended. This is interesting as although any individual can share, if the content does not fall in line with certain aspects it may be flagged and removed.  ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T17:39:08.229163+00:00", "id": "zHc5TBXHEemIY5vdKx67PA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:calvin96@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:calvin96@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:calvin96@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/zHc5TBXHEemIY5vdKx67PA/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/zHc5TBXHEemIY5vdKx67PA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/zHc5TBXHEemIY5vdKx67PA"}, "user": "acct:calvin96@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "startOffset": 146, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "endOffset": 376, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5802, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6032}, {"suffix": "Growth has been stagnant for the", "prefix": "s have come under severe stress.", "exact": " Social media has turned any individual into a broadcaster, and allowed people to hear only the news, facts, and opinions they want to hear. "Breaking news" is a never-ending race for our mainstream broadcasters, and with social media creating a tighter timeline than ever, fact-checking and editing is taking a backseat. Unless you are closely following a story, clickbait and headline news mean even corrections are not as widely seen as an original headline. Additionally, with our broadcasters taking more defined stances in political leaning, this only polarizes us further, enforcing echo chambers that sustain polarity.", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T15:49:47.375537+00:00", "id": "hedUgBW4EemmFVs1Lk52Mw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:cathleenmo@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:cathleenmo@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:cathleenmo@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/hedUgBW4EemmFVs1Lk52Mw/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/hedUgBW4EemmFVs1Lk52Mw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/hedUgBW4EemmFVs1Lk52Mw"}, "user": "acct:cathleenmo@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[10]", "startOffset": 695, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[10]", "endOffset": 738, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8247, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8290}, {"suffix": " and whose civic muscles are atr", "prefix": "policy changes of any kind in a ", "exact": "polarized society that has few shared facts", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T15:36:22.691317+00:00", "text": "These echo chambers work contrary to what we believe social media to do, which is create conversations beyond physical boundaries. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T09:49:03.543361+00:00", "id": "IQw7AhWGEemni98OGBynkA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:shoyamamoto@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:shoyamamoto@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:shoyamamoto@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1H0U9BUnEemC56dLrqYiYA/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/IQw7AhWGEemni98OGBynkA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/IQw7AhWGEemni98OGBynkA"}, "user": "acct:shoyamamoto@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["1H0U9BUnEemC56dLrqYiYA"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy"}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T07:56:30.026391+00:00", "text": "I find it very interesting that Mounk swaps the word "nationalism" out for "patriotism" in his TedTalk. I imagine this may be because the word patriotism would be more well received by a general audience. However, I am also curious to know the way in which Mounk defines nationalism and how that correlates to the idea of inclusivity and unity.  ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T07:56:30.026391+00:00", "id": "Z6bMuBV2EemRcD8TTM1Whg", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:olamajzoub@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:olamajzoub@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:olamajzoub@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/K9EO-hUnEem6OVsHjxFZvg/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Z6bMuBV2EemRcD8TTM1Whg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Z6bMuBV2EemRcD8TTM1Whg"}, "user": "acct:olamajzoub@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["K9EO-hUnEem6OVsHjxFZvg", "kQfXtBVsEemyuIP7qObyTA"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy"}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T07:25:49.867137+00:00", "text": "This reminds me of this Week 2's Reading by Alboim (2011), where the direction of media consumption is more individualized than for a daily national audience, but also how media/journalism moreso write about what they think will sell, and not necessarily what may be considered "important" news. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T07:25:49.867137+00:00", "id": "HtJTxhVyEem8IwNkGuOexA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:janiceaych@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:janiceaych@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:janiceaych@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/qELs3BRbEemvPH8sHHqUDw/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/HtJTxhVyEem8IwNkGuOexA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/HtJTxhVyEem8IwNkGuOexA"}, "user": "acct:janiceaych@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["qELs3BRbEemvPH8sHHqUDw", "dddoWBUzEemf0QsHe994mw"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy"}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T06:46:04.479973+00:00", "text": "It find his choice of words somewhat interesting because in his TedTalk, Mounk calls for building an "inclusive patriotism" (instead of nationalism) by emphasizing what unites people across racial and religious lines rather than what divides them. While the definitions overlap somewhat, I have come to understand nationalism as being a step above patriotism in the sense that it promotes a devotion to one's nation above all else (including other countries perhaps) and I am curious as to what Mounk's view is when it comes to the distinction between these two ideas. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-11T06:46:04.479973+00:00", "id": "kQfXtBVsEemyuIP7qObyTA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:heykevin@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:heykevin@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:heykevin@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Kevin"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/K9EO-hUnEem6OVsHjxFZvg/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/kQfXtBVsEemyuIP7qObyTA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/kQfXtBVsEemyuIP7qObyTA"}, "user": "acct:heykevin@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["K9EO-hUnEem6OVsHjxFZvg"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy"}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T06:23:53.341941+00:00", "text": "I believe a leading reason of the rise of right-wing forces inducing a strong sense of nationalism throughout The West is related to increasing waves of global immigration and the current refugee crisis. The statement “a vision for an integrated society in which nationalism unites people rather than divides them” directs my train of thought towards a blending of the theoretical ideologies of the “Canadian mosaic” and the “American melting pot.” The mosaic model is based on the belief that a country becomes stronger when immigrants bring their cultural diversity with them for all to learn from in a heterogeneous society. The melting pot model forwards the idea of combining foreign elements together into a homogeneous culture driven by fusion and assimilation. I believe both tracks hold problematic elements. The mosaic model can create distance between culturally differing peoples as cultural bonding processes are not required to function in society. The melting pot model primarily forwards a united identity in order to possess social capital, leaving less space for individual cultural practices and beliefs. I posit a further integrated society where nationalism unites will find a middle ground between the two aforementioned social practices. Inclusive nationalism challenges the conventional rhetoric on both right and left", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-11T00:09:51.160085+00:00", "text": "This is an interesting 'most difficult' task to undertake as I feel a notable amount of our 'civic faith' has grassroots in how we consume our media. Considering a rise in gathering information from social media sources, I feel as though the 'difficult' part in this equation is the dichotomy between social media sites and tangible policy change - as these sites are often regarded as illegitimate. It makes me question if policy change and social media can ever co-exist; as it seems these sites could in fact be the solution. On the other hand, I think nationalism itself means different things to people of different nations. I think of American nationalism as xenophobic and racist, but I don't feel the same way about my Canadian patriotism. Maybe nationalism isn't the word I generally think of when referring to my national pride and identity, but there is something to be said for how societies view their country and how they embody their "nationalism."", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-10T23:52:22.714051+00:00", "id": "xi8lihUyEem1-Gc62SJAIA", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:rgentlem@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:rgentlem@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:rgentlem@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "rowansyl"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/xi8lihUyEem1-Gc62SJAIA/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/xi8lihUyEem1-Gc62SJAIA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/xi8lihUyEem1-Gc62SJAIA"}, "user": "acct:rgentlem@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 120, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 144, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8530, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8554}, {"suffix": " Instead of responding to the ri", "prefix": " of nationalism, which he calls ", "exact": "“inclusive nationalism.”", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-10T22:34:02.146602+00:00", "text": "I find it interesting that alleviating the unequal distribution of economic growth is seen here as an easy solution. All three parts of this agenda", "prefix": " “domesticate nationalism,” and ", "exact": "he offer a vision for an integrated society in which nationalism unites people, rather than divides them", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-10T02:07:35.990077+00:00", "text": "From Mounk's article (https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/03/opinion/sunday/liberals-reclaim-nationalism.html) it sounds like he is arguing that liberals just need to reclaim use of the word and use it in a positive way. Is it just a matter of semantics? 'Inclusive nationalism' to describe a multicultural society?", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-10T02:07:35.990077+00:00", "id": "f6ErahR8Eemv5oNEIoaD7Q", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/f6ErahR8Eemv5oNEIoaD7Q/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/f6ErahR8Eemv5oNEIoaD7Q", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/f6ErahR8Eemv5oNEIoaD7Q"}, "user": "acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 51, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 144, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8474, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8567}, {"suffix": " Instead of responding to the ri", "prefix": "g suggestion, however, might be ", "exact": "Mounk’s call for imagining a new form of nationalism, which he calls “inclusive nationalism.”", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-10T01:55:40.765375+00:00", "text": "This makes me think about how many people now access political news/content through social media. The content can be targeted and algorithms created to show an individual posts that are in line with their existing views", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-10T01:55:40.765375+00:00", "id": "1VkuVhR6EemrN7NQgadz6A", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1VkuVhR6EemrN7NQgadz6A/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/1VkuVhR6EemrN7NQgadz6A", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/1VkuVhR6EemrN7NQgadz6A"}, "user": "acct:SarahCampbell@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 122, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 356, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4364, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4598}, {"suffix": ". This meant that even diverse c", "prefix": "tions about social life. First, ", "exact": "the citizenry had a relatively similar worldview because broadcast news, newspapers, radio, and the like were all one-to-many forms of communication in which gatekeepers ensured that news and information remained within the mainstream", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-09T22:27:51.033825+00:00", "text": "This is an interesting statement, as I have never thought of the self-created 'echo chamber' of social media as a means to develop extreme thoughts and ideas or radical opinions. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-09T22:27:51.033825+00:00", "id": "zMt19BRdEemZlJtOu-QjPw", "uri": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/zMt19BRdEemZlJtOu-QjPw/www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/zMt19BRdEemZlJtOu-QjPw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/zMt19BRdEemZlJtOu-QjPw"}, "user": "acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The three crises of liberal democracy |  Ganesh Sitaraman"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/mar/17/the-three-crises-of-liberal-democracy", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "startOffset": 287, "endContainer": "/div[5]/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[7]", "endOffset": 375, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5943, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6031}, {"suffix": " Growth has been stagnant for th", "prefix": "and opinions they want to hear. If I disappear in the near future, please assume some milk-fed farm boys showed up at my house and insisted on removing me to the nearest re-education centre, all the better to expound upon the Greater Glory of Canadian Cream.)", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-18T06:06:20.794852+00:00", "text": "I think politicians in general are afraid of upsetting any groups that have considerable resources to smear them if they got on their wrong side. This reminds me of this week's readings which touches on concerns regarding political marketing, namely the first concern which was unelected advisers. Based on some of their marketing campaigns I've seen, Dairy Farmers of Canada has positioned themselves as preserving the livelihoods of Canadians and providing the nation with important resources and feeding families. It's like an example of how political marketing practices in the hands of outsiders has led the Dairy Farmers of Canada to have such a strong influence on politics. Reminds me of our in-class discussion about how satire can be used to inform and involve the public in political matters. In this context, the author's use of satire is used to persuade the reader about the "ridiculousness" of dairy supply management. Its use of language such as the recurring referral to the DFC as the "dairy cartel" certainly sets the tone and a sense of urgency to the reader about the matter. ", "exact": "Canada is in an enormous pickle on the trade file right now. As Mexico and the U.S. come to a bilateral deal on NAFTA, the pressure is now on us to follow suit.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-17T21:27:17.346337+00:00", "text": "The food libel laws of the U.S. are important to keep in mind during these conversations because allows those critical of the dairy industry to question why there are laws in place to make it easier for food producers to sue their critics. Here, it is evident that not only do these cultural norms surrounding dairy effect consumers, but politicians are also complicit in the critical analysis, or lack of, against these industries.  ", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-17T21:27:17.346337+00:00", "id": "qj5WmhqeEemMz8Pi8hL9NQ", "uri": "https://www.macleans.ca/politics/the-dairy-lobbys-iron-grip-on-canadian-political-leaders-is-frightening-to-behold/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/qj5WmhqeEemMz8Pi8hL9NQ/www.macleans.ca/politics/the-dairy-lobbys-iron-grip-on-canadian-political-leaders-is-frightening-to-behold/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/qj5WmhqeEemMz8Pi8hL9NQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/qj5WmhqeEemMz8Pi8hL9NQ"}, "user": "acct:brooklynoneill@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The dairy lobby's iron grip on Canadian political leaders is frightening to behold - Macleans.ca"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.macleans.ca/politics/the-dairy-lobbys-iron-grip-on-canadian-political-leaders-is-frightening-to-behold/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "post-1145143", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[4]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/span[1]/p[33]", "startOffset": 149, "endContainer": "/div[4]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/span[1]/p[33]", "endOffset": 470, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 34393, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 34714}, {"suffix": "
Chickens, the whole lot of them", "prefix": "rmers would be craven and daft. ", "exact": "The fact that our politicians seem so utterly beholden to the dairy lobby, so completely unwilling make the decision that is so obviously in the national interest, and so ill-equipped to fight a special-interest group for the benefit of Middle Class Families—that is probably the most damning observation anyone can make.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-17T21:22:23.111735+00:00", "text": "It is broad and inaccurate to say Canadians don't care about where their dairy and poultry comes from. Rather, Canadians should be encouraged to question those behind the industry and the power these industries hold. I disagree with the writer, I think there are many Canadians, certainly in Vancouver who are conscious and interested in the source of their food. Does the public understand that the idea of consumers paying higher prices is directly going towards helping dairy farmers stabilize their own income? This affects low income families the most as they are paying for a premium to help protect dairy farmers profits. Do we really need to be helping these farmers? The average Canadian household income is $69,100 compared to an average dairy farming household income of $180,400. This is a very interesting dilemma in my opinion. […] People new to this society", "prefix": "n the world, the American women,", "exact": " are not paid as well as the American men are for doing one-eighth as well", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-14T23:08:41.804244+00:00", "text": "She is encouraging the idea that their is space for people of colour and different religious beliefs in sport, as white people currently appear to be wanting to save sport as a space for them alone.", "tags": [], "updated": "2019-01-14T23:08:41.804244+00:00", "id": "VZ6GmhhREem_f_No9yXyNA", "uri": "https://www.mcgilldaily.com/2017/03/sitting-down-with-shireen-ahmed/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:mstoughton@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:mstoughton@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:mstoughton@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/VZ6GmhhREem_f_No9yXyNA/www.mcgilldaily.com/2017/03/sitting-down-with-shireen-ahmed/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/VZ6GmhhREem_f_No9yXyNA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/VZ6GmhhREem_f_No9yXyNA"}, "user": "acct:mstoughton@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Sitting down with Shireen Ahmed | The McGill Daily"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.mcgilldaily.com/2017/03/sitting-down-with-shireen-ahmed/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "main", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/p[27]", "startOffset": 41, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/p[27]", "endOffset": 145, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 13700, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 13804}, {"suffix": " I had a friend tell me, I’ve ne", "prefix": "lot of circles in this country, ", "exact": "white people are the gatekeepers. And how does [resisting] that work in sports? You make your own space.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2019-01-14T23:06:52.788781+00:00", "text": "The banning of the hijab also bans women from participating in something that is such a valued piece of themselves, hindering their self-esteem. resp: [{"created": "2018-01-14T22:42:34.865969+00:00", "text": "Could be argued that there has been a devolution rather than a revolution in morals; that the revolution of means of technology has perpetuated society's capacity and acceptance of wrongness, which in turn has fueled the sort of apathy that made the Trump presidency possible. As freedom of speech, even in democracies, comes under attack by ruling alt-right governments or regimes, dissent of any kind is suppressed. *sigh*", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T08:08:43.540490+00:00", "id": "Tc15CPnLEeelnqew3kYDMQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/Tc15CPnLEeelnqew3kYDMQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Tc15CPnLEeelnqew3kYDMQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Tc15CPnLEeelnqew3kYDMQ"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[1]", "startOffset": 664, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[1]", "endOffset": 749, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 21719, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 21804}, {"suffix": "s.And, if it was ever thus, how ", "prefix": "e Vandals were at the gates, and", "exact": " next thing you knew there wasn\u2019t a hot bath or a good book for another thousand year", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T08:07:16.138414+00:00", "text": "On a personal note, I struggle with this concept of overwhelming access to knowledge on a daily basis. I think it's particularly hard for me to get lost down rabbit holes as I am indeed a keen learner. I am, however, identifying a need to focus my reading time in a more active manner. The opposite of the village idiot is the know-it-all savant... and in my opinion, they're both bad. One knows nothing, the other knows a little about everything but not much about any one thing. This is my personal challenge in designing a career... the conscious decision to start ignoring some things.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T08:07:16.138414+00:00", "id": "Ga2fkPnLEee5--O5HhDVQA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/Ga2fkPnLEee5--O5HhDVQA/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Ga2fkPnLEee5--O5HhDVQA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Ga2fkPnLEee5--O5HhDVQA"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[6]/p[6]", "startOffset": 1108, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[6]/p[6]", "endOffset": 1159, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 20041, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 20092}, {"suffix": "Blair\u2019s and Pettegree\u2019s work on ", "prefix": "the general complaint was that t", "exact": "here wasn\u2019t enough time to read big, classic books.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T08:00:07.603566+00:00", "text": "There has been extended discussion on the extreme difference between what \"the Internet\" set out to be - i.e., a tool of knowledge dissemination - and what it ended up becoming, i.e. a free-for-all and an infinity of avenues to exploit and unravel the illegal and indecent. On the one hand, this polarity can be regarded as \"freedom of speech\" but on the other, it has victimized and subjugated many.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T08:00:07.603566+00:00", "id": "GkCL5PnKEeeFS_tGu6BMqQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/GkCL5PnKEeeFS_tGu6BMqQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/GkCL5PnKEeeFS_tGu6BMqQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/GkCL5PnKEeeFS_tGu6BMqQ"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[3]", "startOffset": 793, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[3]", "endOffset": 903, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 10580, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 10690}, {"suffix": " Our trouble is not the over-all", "prefix": "ed with unreliable information. ", "exact": "Creationists crowd cyberspace every bit as effectively as evolutionists, and extend their minds just as fully.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:47:39.268248+00:00", "text": "The uses given to Television had expanded and the experience is no longer the same that it was 40, 50 or 60 years ago. People no longer sits to see whatever is broadcast by a company with a fixed schedule, today it works more like an extension of the internet we are discussing,call it Netflix, Steam, etc. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:48:35.937069+00:00", "id": "XDvFiPnIEee2NBPXG7jnSg", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/XDvFiPnIEee2NBPXG7jnSg/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/XDvFiPnIEee2NBPXG7jnSg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/XDvFiPnIEee2NBPXG7jnSg"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[7]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[7]", "endOffset": 164, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 26195, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 26359}, {"suffix": " This makes you think that what ", "prefix": "omputer screen to read \u201cWalden.\u201d", "exact": "Now television is the harmless little fireplace over in the corner, where the family gathers to watch \u201cEntourage.\u201d TV isn\u2019t just docile; it\u2019s positively benevolent.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:42:47.218909+00:00", "text": "Part of this \"malice\" should include the huge amounts of ads in this page, trying to sell me all kind of things I don't need or desire. \nBut yes, what it is in our minds leads the way we experience the web and the kind of things we try to get from it. However, that creates an issue because once I get it, the risk of AMPLIFICATION becomes far greater.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:43:54.217598+00:00", "id": "rh0oSPnHEeeUMDen2Jh9BQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/rh0oSPnHEeeUMDen2Jh9BQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/rh0oSPnHEeeUMDen2Jh9BQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/rh0oSPnHEeeUMDen2Jh9BQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[3]", "startOffset": 1015, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[3]", "endOffset": 1137, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 23809, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 23931}, {"suffix": " and have always in the past soc", "prefix": "a little truth and reflection.) ", "exact": "Thus the limitless malice of Internet commenting: it\u2019s not newly unleashed anger but what we all think in the first order,", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:36:03.492611+00:00", "text": "Not necessarily.\n", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:36:03.492611+00:00", "id": "vX_V8vnGEee59jOOV3hXTQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/vX_V8vnGEee59jOOV3hXTQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/vX_V8vnGEee59jOOV3hXTQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/vX_V8vnGEee59jOOV3hXTQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[1]", "startOffset": 557, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/p[1]", "endOffset": 594, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 21612, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 21649}, {"suffix": ",\u201d one Roman reassured another w", "prefix": " generation has its barbarians, ", "exact": "and every generation assimilates them", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:35:03.151730+00:00", "text": "Probably, because there is a rush to \"advance\" forward, but no clear goal to aim to. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:35:03.151730+00:00", "id": "mYz39vnGEeeAiWu3VbMhZA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/mYz39vnGEeeAiWu3VbMhZA/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/mYz39vnGEeeAiWu3VbMhZA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/mYz39vnGEeeAiWu3VbMhZA"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[6]/p[7]", "startOffset": 177, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[6]/p[7]", "endOffset": 355, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 20269, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 20447}, {"suffix": "When there were automatic looms,", "prefix": "leads you to a broader thought: ", "exact": "at any given moment, our most complicated machine will be taken as a model of human intelligence, and whatever media kids favor will be identified as the cause of our stupidity. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:26:01.427838+00:00", "text": "This is exactly what the dangers of the current web contents are about. Discrediting Heidegger because he joined the \"Nazi\" appealing to the common agreed premise: If Nazi->Evil thus, by a simple conditional Syllogism, Heidegger -> Evil. Despite his allegiance to the Nazi Party, Heidegger is one of the most important philosophers of our era, his work on Hermeneutics fundamental to understand what is happening today in the WWW and recognized even by Jewish philosophers such as Ludwig Wittgenstein. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:30:08.604369+00:00", "id": "VqF4vvnFEeekg8dsygM5_w", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/VqF4vvnFEeekg8dsygM5_w/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/VqF4vvnFEeekg8dsygM5_w", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/VqF4vvnFEeekg8dsygM5_w"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[5]/p[5]", "startOffset": 175, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[5]/p[5]", "endOffset": 352, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 14326, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 14503}, {"suffix": "One feels the same doubts when S", "prefix": "n which Western wisdoms depend. It isn\u2019t just that we\u2019ve lived", "prefix": "o lend weight to the claim that ", "exact": "the technological shifts in communication we\u2019re living with are unprecedented", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:22:33.068008+00:00", "text": "Much of literature demands \"suspension of belief\" but I do enjoy the point Gopnik makes here.\n", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:22:33.068008+00:00", "id": "2nH9wvnEEee_1GPgy5lJeA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/2nH9wvnEEee_1GPgy5lJeA/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/2nH9wvnEEee_1GPgy5lJeA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/2nH9wvnEEee_1GPgy5lJeA"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "startOffset": 332, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "endOffset": 340, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 679, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 687}, {"suffix": " that a wizard in training might", "prefix": "s or how to make a love potion. ", "exact": "The idea", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:13:06.656502+00:00", "text": "That is the point to have different points of view, in the most basic Hegelian Dialectic exercise. Why disregard the Creationists as stupids (or the Evolutionists) when the point is not who is right, but how many believe what is right under each thesis?\n\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dialectic", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:13:50.842619+00:00", "id": "iM_JKPnDEeeAuz97pPWpiA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/iM_JKPnDEeeAuz97pPWpiA/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/iM_JKPnDEeeAuz97pPWpiA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/iM_JKPnDEeeAuz97pPWpiA"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[3]", "startOffset": 793, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[3]", "endOffset": 1062, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 10580, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 10849}, {"suffix": "The books by the Better-Nevers a", "prefix": "ed with unreliable information. ", "exact": "Creationists crowd cyberspace every bit as effectively as evolutionists, and extend their minds just as fully. Our trouble is not the over-all absence of smartness but the intractable power of pure stupidity, and no machine, or mind, seems extended enough to cure that.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T07:06:47.858533+00:00", "text": "Yes, but this can be said about every culture and civilization. This statement seems to appeal to a corporate or insect-like model that I truly dread as we would lost our humanity to a number of commodities that in the end mean the false illusion of \"Happiness\". ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:06:47.858533+00:00", "id": "pwwgmvnCEeej-J-jZrBuOQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/pwwgmvnCEeej-J-jZrBuOQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/pwwgmvnCEeej-J-jZrBuOQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/pwwgmvnCEeej-J-jZrBuOQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[1]", "startOffset": 525, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[4]/p[1]", "endOffset": 731, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8713, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8919}, {"suffix": " Contraptions don\u2019t change consc", "prefix": "g goes on out there as in here. ", "exact": "If television produced the global village, the Internet produces the global psyche: everyone keyed in like a neuron, so that to the eyes of a watching Martian we are really part of a single planetary brain.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T06:58:04.750066+00:00", "text": "Is Internet and the resulting Web, the cause or the result of freedom? I am inclined to think the latter. Before 1991, the Cold War was a very real, everyday treat, every country on each side of the conflict suffered from censorship, strict vigilance, abuse to human rights, etc. Governments, like that of Salvador Allende in Chile were deposed by Dictators defending \"freedom\" the whole world was a mess ad this was not limited to politics and people in power, entire populations were convinced their social system was the right one.. It was until the fall of the Soviet Union that the Social Conditions existed to lead into what we call WWW. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T07:00:11.451553+00:00", "id": "bzwMTvnBEeeA-oNP7QU7Ww", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/bzwMTvnBEeeA-oNP7QU7Ww/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/bzwMTvnBEeeA-oNP7QU7Ww", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/bzwMTvnBEeeA-oNP7QU7Ww"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[4]", "startOffset": 515, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[4]", "endOffset": 630, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 8073, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 8188}, {"suffix": "Many of the more knowing Never-B", "prefix": "untable for the bad stuff, too. ", "exact": "The Internet may make for more freedom a hundred years from now, but there\u2019s no historical law that says it has to.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T06:49:17.634716+00:00", "text": "It is not technology what changes societies, it is the use people give to it. Having said the obvious, there were countless movements similar to the \"Reformation\" in civilizations, thousands of years in the past, despite not having a printing press at hand. What makes me think that the only real effect such technologies have (inlcuding the Web), is the speed at which such movements can spread and the organizational level they grant.\nLastly, even the rampang anti-Semitism quoted, was not proposed by Luther, but was a very old issue fueled mostly by economic interests rather than spiritual ones. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T06:50:59.410201+00:00", "id": "NRIgwvnAEeekglsgHU5iuQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/NRIgwvnAEeekglsgHU5iuQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/NRIgwvnAEeekglsgHU5iuQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/NRIgwvnAEeekglsgHU5iuQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[2]", "startOffset": 305, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[2]", "endOffset": 447, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5839, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5981}, {"suffix": " And what followed the Reformati", "prefix": "is a cruel cartoon of the truth.", "exact": " If the printing press did propel the Reformation, one of the biggest ideas it propelled was Luther\u2019s newly invented absolutist anti-Semitism.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T06:44:35.177488+00:00", "text": "Hardly, if at most, we are on the middle of an information storm (understanding information as \"processed data\"). Which is not necessarily democratic, sources cannot be checked, fake contents and news are given authority just because they are \"on the internet\", and censorship and bias abounds, it is an era where information is readily available to consume by anyone wishing to believe in it, whatever it is about, and given relevance only by the illusion of being \"democratic\" based on its consumption rating (i.e. likes, shares, etc). \n  ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T06:45:12.538905+00:00", "id": "jLW-Fvm_EeekgPuH_oIIDA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/jLW-Fvm_EeekgPuH_oIIDA/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/jLW-Fvm_EeekgPuH_oIIDA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/jLW-Fvm_EeekgPuH_oIIDA"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[1]", "startOffset": 422, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[1]", "endOffset": 515, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4484, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4577}, {"suffix": " the Gutenberg printing press pr", "prefix": "le nervous going on underneath. ", "exact": "Shirky believes that we are on the crest of an ever-surging wave of democratized information:", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-12T17:39:25.841173+00:00", "text": "It's worrisome to think about how AI is being used, and will continue to be used, in this context, as AI is not so much a new medium as it is a new way of creating content that we have much less control over.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-12T17:39:25.841173+00:00", "id": "iJE9MPe_EeeHboPgn5ku2w", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions":
