{"incontext": "https://hyp.is/iJE9MPe_EeeHboPgn5ku2w/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/iJE9MPe_EeeHboPgn5ku2w", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/iJE9MPe_EeeHboPgn5ku2w"}, "user": "acct:spruys@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[3]", "startOffset": 342, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[3]", "endOffset": 379, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7170, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7207}, {"suffix": " as they ever were by libertaria", "prefix": "hen by modern totalitarians, to ", "exact": "reduce liberty and enforce conformity", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-12T17:31:14.284074+00:00", "text": "It\u2019s interesting how we want to pinpoint a moment in time when everything changed (giving credit to that one invention or one person), rather than think about the multiple forces that were at play all over the world leading to change. Change does not exist in a vacuum.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-12T17:31:14.284074+00:00", "id": "Y4-uePe-EeeppOu78RH7BQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/Y4-uePe-EeeppOu78RH7BQ/www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Y4-uePe-EeeppOu78RH7BQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Y4-uePe-EeeppOu78RH7BQ"}, "user": "acct:spruys@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How the Internet Gets Inside Us"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2011/02/14/the-information", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[1]", "startOffset": 516, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/p[1]", "endOffset": 722, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4578, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4784}, {"suffix": " Though it may take a little tim", "prefix": "ve of democratized information: ", "exact": "the Gutenberg printing press produced the Reformation, which produced the Scientific Revolution, which produced the Enlightenment, which produced the Internet, each move more liberating than the one before.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}]

title: Dash, Anil. 2016. There is no “technology industry.” Medium.
resp: [{"created": "2018-01-15T08:21:55.969725+00:00", "text": "I should like to point out that the reality of the matter is that no matter how precise one is in terms of nomenclature, none of that matters, unfortunately, if the governing bodies do not truly protect consumers. Anil Dash makes all sorts of fair points, but for a society more like Iceland, where the bankers and "tech gurus" of the financial crisis of 2008 were actually found at-fault and properly dealt with. The American conglomerates are so powerful and yet so carefully hidden behind all sorts of curtains, that nothing really does happen to the top heads of each one.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T08:21:55.969725+00:00", "id": "JhdM3vnNEeeOJLNpF70uzQ", "uri": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/JhdM3vnNEeeOJLNpF70uzQ/medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/JhdM3vnNEeeOJLNpF70uzQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/JhdM3vnNEeeOJLNpF70uzQ"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["There is no “technology industry” – Humane Tech – Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[1]", "startOffset": 54, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[1]", "endOffset": 137, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 6904, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6987}, {"suffix": ". Rather than accepting that a c", "prefix": "The first place to start may be ", "exact": "simply be in more precise language about the companies that are shaping our society", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T08:15:05.472612+00:00", "text": "These entities can no longer be addressed just as "companies" in the typical sense, which requires a careful use of language and a new classification for them, yet, it is people who empowers them by hitting the "Agree" button just to get the (usually free) service they offer. Sometimes, willingly, others unwillingly. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T08:15:05.472612+00:00", "id": "MW9A4vnMEeeR_dMEplzuxw", "uri": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/MW9A4vnMEeeR_dMEplzuxw/medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/MW9A4vnMEeeR_dMEplzuxw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/MW9A4vnMEeeR_dMEplzuxw"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["There is no “technology industry” – Humane Tech – Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[1]", "startOffset": 139, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[1]", "endOffset": 545, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 6995, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7401}, {"suffix": "Should Facebook be regulated lik", "prefix": "s that are shaping our society. ", "exact": "Rather than accepting that a company like Facebook, which knows more about our personal lives than any entity that’s ever existed, is simply “tech”, we should talk about it as an information broker, as an agent of government surveillance, as a media publisher, as a producer of unmanned drones, or in any other specific description that will assign appropriate accountability and context to their actions. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-13T09:29:24.059412+00:00", "text": "One of the reasons corporations have subsidiaries is precisely to dodge the SEC. It's presence doesn't assure transparency and accountability. Amazon, Facebook and their ilk - all of whom have their fingers in too many pies - might prefer to hide under the moniker of "tech" companies because it probably enables them to get away with full disclosure of profits and losses and assets and liabilities of all the companies they own.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-13T09:29:24.059412+00:00", "id": "PiQFGPhEEeepZI-Zo_xoQA", "uri": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/PiQFGPhEEeepZI-Zo_xoQA/medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/PiQFGPhEEeepZI-Zo_xoQA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/PiQFGPhEEeepZI-Zo_xoQA"}, "user": "acct:Leena@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["There is no “technology industry” – Humane Tech – Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/humane-tech/there-is-no-technology-industry-44774dfb3ed7", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "startOffset": 263, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "endOffset": 392, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5271, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5400}, {"suffix": "That’s the situation we may find", "prefix": " unprepared to handle the task. ", "exact": "We can criticize how the SEC responded to the financial crisis, but what would it have looked like if we hadn’t even had an SEC? ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-13T05:08:46.585653+00:00", "text": "This would be a difficult matter, even if the world creates a norm or governments create specific laws which regulate "tech companies", it just won't catch up to how technology is changing. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-28T23:56:25.327566+00:00", "text": "I feel like this is more of a public school issue. I was home schooled growing up. I learned quickly I had need of an email address, and I learned to manage it. This may not be a domain but it is a good starting place. Being in control of my own correspondence made a huge difference to me. I could talk to others on topics the I understood, could play games online, and more. Eventually, I started college and had more things. I had known for years that email controls, and communicates with other platforms. I would use my email to send documents and keep my own copy as a back up in my email. I could keep or send others emails and homework I would submit. I Even found ways to send it to phones when I needed. Email addresses are an important step in this process. I have been told, by my cousins and my wife, that they never even made email addresses; until, they were juniors in high school.", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-28T23:56:25.327566+00:00", "id": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]/span[1]", "startOffset": 175, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]/span[1]", "endOffset": 321, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2995, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3141}, {"suffix": "There is an understandable learning curve to helping students manage their online presence via their own domain. \u201cAt first there was a fair amount of fumbling around, Googling solutions, and trying to understand their options,\u201d said teacher Clarence Fisher. \u201cWithin a week, the kids were able to understand what their options were and how their site was affected by changes they made. As time went on, we talked a lot more about technical issues (backup, recovery, privacy options, hosting laws in different countries, etc). But we also talked a lot more about digital citizenship, safety, control, design, etc. The kids saw the site much more as their own and their responsibility.\u201dThe importance of giving students responsibility for their own domain cannot be overstated. This can be a way to track growth and demonstrate new learning over the course of a student\u2019s school career\u200a\u2014\u200asomething that they themselves can reflect upon, not simply grades and assignments that are locked away in a proprietary system controlled by the school.And if a student owns their own domain, as she moves from grade to grade and from school to school, all that information\u200a\u2014\u200atheir learning portfolio\u200a\u2014\u200acan travel with them.Education technology\u200a\u2014\u200aand more broadly, the culture of education\u200a\u2014\u200adoes a terrible job with this sort of portability and interoperability. When a student moves to a new school, for example, they often have to request their transcript, a document that lists their courses and their grades. A transcript is by definition a copy of their education record. The transcript is often printed on a piece of paper with formal letterhead, perhaps with a watermark or stamp to show that it\u2019s \u201cofficial.\u201d This lack of portability continues in much digital schoolwork too. Even if students are encouraged to create online portfolios or to use services like Google Apps for Education in order to store all their work, they don\u2019t actually get to take that work with them when they move or graduate. (In the case of Google Apps, you can download your files. But then you\u2019ll need to find a new place to store them.) Too often, students\u2019 work in these systems gets deleted over the summer months as schools aren\u2019t in the business of permanently storing student work. School district IT is not the right steward for student work: the student is.Giving students their own digital domain is a radical act. It gives them the ability to work on the Web and with the Web, to have their scholarship be meaningful and accessible by others. It allows them to demonstrate their learning to others beyond the classroom walls. To own one\u2019s domain gives students an understanding of how Web technologies work. It puts them in a much better position to control their work, their data, their identity online.\u201cI want to know where my ones and zeros are stored,\u201d said Bryan Jackson, referring to the basic binary code in which computers \u2018think.\u2019 \u201cAnd I want my students to know that that\u2019s something they can ask about, and learn to manage for themselves.\u201dIllustrations by Lisk FengBright is made possible by funding from the New Venture Fund, and is supported by The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. ", "exact": "I cannot and will not silence myself, trade diversity of thought for a few CV lines, and gag opinion because my expression might upset an abstract group of \u201cothers.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-07-15T16:04:13.959861+00:00", "text": "Such a great statement, and lesson to be learned, as a student it speaks volumes to the type of educator that I too hope to become. Afterall, these students will soon become adults and will making decisions for us as the older generation.", "tags": ["#nousion"], "updated": "2016-06-24T16:44:37.857489+00:00", "id": "8HN4aDoqEeapifNADM7EPg", "uri": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/8HN4aDoqEeapifNADM7EPg/medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/8HN4aDoqEeapifNADM7EPg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/8HN4aDoqEeapifNADM7EPg"}, "user": "acct:hcolson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713"}]}, {"created": "2016-06-24T16:39:33.998311+00:00", "text": "There are some students who have no idea what this might look like. Let's get them outside of their comfort zone!", "tags": ["#nousion"], "updated": "2016-06-24T16:40:28.105213+00:00", "id": "O1eSrDoqEeawxRPhKg05hw", "uri": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:hcolson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/O1eSrDoqEeawxRPhKg05hw/medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/O1eSrDoqEeawxRPhKg05hw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/O1eSrDoqEeawxRPhKg05hw"}, "user": "acct:hcolson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713"}]}, {"created": "2016-06-24T16:37:08.163182+00:00", "text": "The perfect college transcript! One that has much more meaning then a list of vague course titles and a 1 or 2 character evaluation. It could be a true portfolio that grows with you as you move through a program. Sure, as an incoming student your posts or artifacts may seem shallow when compared to those towards your later academic career, but that shows growth and the ability to learn and digger deeper. "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVO3VveRH9ZO4OKSlaM8", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVO3VveRH9ZO4OKSlaM8"}, "user": "acct:orschiro@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/"}]}, {"created": "2016-02-03T14:33:06.193371+00:00", "text": "May be this threat can be overcome by simpler infrastructure that can be understood by a single person. That was one of the original goals of Smalltalk and I think that its current incarnations (in [Pharo](http://pharo.org/) or [Cuis](http://cuis-smalltalk.org/)) address this personal empowerment better that the Unix/OS current tradition, which informs most of our current experience with technology. Fossil instead of Git is another example of this preference for simplicity. So, 1000 smaller agile communities can be possible instead of 10 big bureaucratic ones, making fork still an important right without a lot of balkanization. The open nature of these agile communities is different of private projects locked inside a company.\n\nI have experience by myself examples of those different kind of community configurations and different thresholds for participation in the case of Debian, Arch Linux, Leo Editor or Pharo (to cite a few) and that's why the idea of agile open and small community could work, even with the proper pains of addressing complex projects/problems inside them.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-02-03T17:01:54.894902+00:00", "id": "AVKnjRGYvTW_3w8Lys14", "uri": "https://medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKnjRGYvTW_3w8Lys14/medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKnjRGYvTW_3w8Lys14", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKnjRGYvTW_3w8Lys14"}, "user": "acct:offray@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[93]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[95]", "endOffset": 82, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 21573, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 21987}, {"suffix": "The Road AheadStandards like the", "prefix": "f contributing back to old ones.", "exact": "Instead of, for example, 100 large open source projects with active communities, we\u2019ve got 10,000 tiny repos with redundant functionality.One of open source\u2019s biggest advantages was resilience. A public project with many contributors was theoretically stronger than a private project locked inside a company with fewer contributors.Now, the widespread adoption of open source threatens to create just the opposite.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-02-02T18:08:10.728753+00:00", "text": "That's why I have advocated tools like [Fossil](http://fossil-scm.org/) to other members of our [Hackerspace](http://hackbo.co/) and other communities like [Pharo](http://pharo.org/community) or [decentralized options to Mozilla Science](https://twitter.com/offrayLC/status/598861062096683009) (without much acceptation in the communities or even any reaction from Mozilla Science). \n\nGoing with the *de facto* and popular defaults (without caring about freedom or diversity) seems the position of open source/science communities and even digital activist, which contrast sharply with their discourse for the building of tools/data/politics, but seems invisible in the building of community/metadata/metapolitics.\n\nThe kind of disempowerment these communities are trying to fight, is the one they're suffering with GitHub, like showed here: https://hypothes.is/a/AVKjLddpvTW_3w8LyrU-\n\nSo there is a tension between the convenience and wider awareness/participation of centralized privative platforms that is wanted by these open/activist communities and a growth in the (over)use of the commons that is bigger that the growth of its sustainability/ethos, as shown here: https://hypothes.is/a/AVKjfsTRvTW_3w8LyrqI . Sacrificing growth/convenience by choosing simpler and more coherent infrastructures aligned with the commons and its ethos seems a sensible approach then.", "tags": ["post open source", "centralization", "PhD"], "updated": "2016-02-03T16:57:41.687957+00:00", "id": "AVKjK53vvTW_3w8LyrU2", "uri": "https://medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:offray@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKjK53vvTW_3w8LyrU2/medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKjK53vvTW_3w8LyrU2", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKjK53vvTW_3w8LyrU2"}, "user": "acct:offray@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/@nayafia/we-re-in-a-brave-new-post-open-source-world-56ef46d152a3", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[71]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[72]", "endOffset": 316, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 16144, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 16652}, {"suffix": "", "exact": "There is an understandable learning curve to helping students manage their online presence via their own domain.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-12T01:36:51.604913+00:00", "text": "I was not aware of this; how Google Apps don't always have a place to store work to make it portable. ", "exact": "Even if students are encouraged to create online portfolios or to use services like Google Apps for Education in order to store all their work, they don\u2019t actually get to take that work with them when they move or graduate. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-12T00:59:15.441063+00:00", "text": "As far as I am aware, a Google Doc is safe from advertisers and other companies as it excludes those who are not in the selected group of emailers. Therefore, having a place to freely express opinions increases discussion material.", "tags": ["#dgst101"], "updated": "2016-01-11T22:10:34.149230+00:00", "id": "AVIyvXQU8sFu_DXLVauR", "uri": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVIyvXQU8sFu_DXLVauR/medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVIyvXQU8sFu_DXLVauR", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVIyvXQU8sFu_DXLVauR"}, "user": "acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[3]/p[2]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[3]/p[2]", "endOffset": 183, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7018, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7201}, {"suffix": " Students have control over the ", "prefix": "f education technology software.", "exact": "Having one\u2019s own domain means that students have much more say over what they present to the world, in terms of their public profiles, professional portfolios, and digital identities.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-11T21:45:47.296510+00:00", "text": "I think this attitude helps cultivate a more stimulating and interactive environment for students. ", "tags": ["#dgst101"], "updated": "2016-01-11T21:32:46.319449+00:00", "id": "AVIymwV-8sFu_DXLVasw", "uri": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVIyA1Na8sFu_DXLVahQ/medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVIymwV-8sFu_DXLVasw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVIymwV-8sFu_DXLVasw"}, "user": "acct:aedwardz@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["How To Quit \u2014 Assist Stories \u2014 Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["AVIyA1Na8sFu_DXLVahQ"], "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/bright/the-web-we-need-to-give-students-311d97713713"}]}, {"created": "2016-01-11T19:11:47.756766+00:00", "text": "This is an interesting bit because I'm getting the vibe that Watters is undermining the importance of digital citizenship being taught in schools. I understand and agree that giving young people their own independent web domain is a great case for individuality, but I'd sooner have a high schooler learn about the repercussions of cyber bullying than running a website. I find this ironic because she seems to think this isn't as important but later mentions that students who were given domains still talked frequently about proper digital citizenship. I may not be understanding her properly, but I'm not exactly following this train of thought.", "tags": ["dgst101"], "updated": "2016-01-11T19:11:47.756785+00:00", "id": "AVIyGfQ_8sFu_DXLVakF", "uri": title: Derakhshan, Hossein. 2015, July 14. The Web We Have to Save. Medium.
resp: [{"created": "2018-01-15T11:31:50.057113+00:00", "text": "Rather an evo (invo/devo)-lution of society, so hurriedly racing towards the future with no goal. Shall we colonize mars? Shall we stop the end of the universe? Shall we always be happy? What is that we pursue that has us so aimed towards demanding those changes so rapidly? ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T11:31:50.057113+00:00", "id": "rX7uEPnnEeeTwF_pzrfkKQ", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/rX7uEPnnEeeTwF_pzrfkKQ/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/rX7uEPnnEeeTwF_pzrfkKQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/rX7uEPnnEeeTwF_pzrfkKQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "e2f4", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "startOffset": 58, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "endOffset": 112, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 20929, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 20983}, {"suffix": " But I can’t close my eyes to wh", "prefix": "m becoming too strict as I age. ", "exact": "Maybe this is all a natural evolution of a technology.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T11:27:28.640270+00:00", "text": "Same goes for messages and communications in general, written or spoken. One can argue that watching a video takes less effort than reading and referencing a text, but the main point is, if this economy of communication imposed by the medium is what we as humans are really pursuing.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T11:27:28.640270+00:00", "id": "EbFE7PnnEee7Vc_nezG6SQ", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/EbFE7PnnEee7Vc_nezG6SQ/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/EbFE7PnnEee7Vc_nezG6SQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/EbFE7PnnEee7Vc_nezG6SQ"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[11]", "startOffset": 269, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[11]", "endOffset": 391, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 18963, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 19085}, {"suffix": "Are we witnessing a decline of r", "prefix": "ost people spend their time on. ", "exact": "There’s less and less text to read on social networks, and more and more video to watch, more and more images to look at. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T09:05:44.597362+00:00", "text": "As I really enjoyed Derahkshan's writing, I did a bit of digging and found some more of his writing. This is a recent article that he wrote on the topic http://www.niemanlab.org/2017/12/television-has-won/", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T09:05:44.597362+00:00", "id": "ROgUdvnTEeerBLtSExLUzw", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:a.ste@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Anna"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/ROgUdvnTEeerBLtSExLUzw/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/ROgUdvnTEeerBLtSExLUzw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/ROgUdvnTEeerBLtSExLUzw"}, "user": "acct:a.ste@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "b3fb", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[13]", "startOffset": 56, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[13]", "endOffset": 133, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 19922, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 19999}, {"suffix": " We seem to have gone from a non", "prefix": "pplications, and moving images: ", "exact": "They all show a departure from a books-internet toward a television-internet.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T05:27:38.904278+00:00", "text": "I don't know if it's the time that has elapsed since the publication of the article or the perspective of the author, but this perspective seems outdated. People no longer get used to surveillance; they embrace it. They buy phones and computers with built in personal assistants like Siri and buy home devices that listen 24/7 to everything people are saying. We give them names. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T05:27:38.904278+00:00", "id": "zS4yvPm0EeefH6MgbVhTfA", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/zS4yvPm0EeefH6MgbVhTfA/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/zS4yvPm0EeefH6MgbVhTfA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/zS4yvPm0EeefH6MgbVhTfA"}, "user": "acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[8]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[8]", "endOffset": 78, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 17437, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 17515}, {"suffix": " and, sadly, it has nothing to d", "prefix": " if you can’t make it 300 years.", "exact": "Being watched is something we all eventually have to get used to and live with", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-14T23:29:21.301109+00:00", "text": "I come from an unusual family. Neither of my three siblings are on Twitter, Facebook or Instagram. And all three are avid readers. Where do they get their information from? Instead of relying on social media, they go to the websites/blogs they trust, like and follow and read stories on that. Let's hope they aren't the only ones doing this. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-14T23:29:21.301109+00:00", "id": "v6BUNvmCEeeEiJdr43mxDw", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Leena@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/v6BUNvmCEeeEiJdr43mxDw/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/v6BUNvmCEeeEiJdr43mxDw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/v6BUNvmCEeeEiJdr43mxDw"}, "user": "acct:Leena@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "startOffset": 128, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "endOffset": 330, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 21486, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 21688}, {"suffix": "That’s the web I remember before", "prefix": " a paragraph or 140 characters. ", "exact": "I miss the days when I could write something on my own blog, publish on my own domain, without taking an equal time to promote it on numerous social networks; when nobody cared about likes and reshares.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-13T04:58:53.270361+00:00", "text": "I remembered one time I asked my 15 year old cousin on why he reads newspaper headlines every morning instead of just browing his twitter feeds for news. His reply was quite staggering: "I don't believe that anyone can explain something in just 280 characters or less. They may deliver the point, but surely they are missing something. A small part. It may be crucial or it may not be. But I chose the later. It's always nice to have more rather than just enough." So actually there's hope for millenials. Unfortunately, not all of them are like my cousins. Majority of them only want to know "what's happening" rather than "why is it happening." And for that, 280 characters is enough. And if they are not busy enough to find out why is it happening .. they watch the video while doing their dishes. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-13T05:18:14.848708+00:00", "id": "c85o3PgeEeefDrvKrXw-Bw", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/c85o3PgeEeefDrvKrXw-Bw/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/c85o3PgeEeefDrvKrXw-Bw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/c85o3PgeEeefDrvKrXw-Bw"}, "user": "acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[11]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[3]/p[11]", "endOffset": 476, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 18695, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 19171}, {"suffix": "Is this trend driven by people’s", "prefix": " or the centralization, exactly.", "exact": "Maybe it’s that text itself is disappearing. After all, the first visitors to the web spent their time online reading web magazines. Then came blogs, then Facebook, then Twitter. Now it’s Facebook videos and Instagram and SnapChat that most people spend their time on. There’s less and less text to read on social networks, and more and more video to watch, more and more images to look at. Are we witnessing a decline of reading on the web in favor of watching and listening?", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-12T19:46:44.060858+00:00", "text": "Given the events in CanLit this past week, I'm curious to see if blogging circa the mid-2000s will make a comeback. First Mike Spry wrote "No Names, Only Monsters: Toxic Masculinity, Concordia, and CanLit," and then Julie McIsaac responded with "And Then a Man Said It." Both essays were published on their own websites, and as Friday morning both remain standalone posts on their clean and simple sites. But in a social media driven world where it's so hard to hear as everyone is shouting, maybe we'll go back to blogging. Because that space is all about the "democratization of writing," as Derakhshan says. And you can't accurately say that about social media platforms with all of their algorithms anymore. Links: http://canlitaccountable.com/; https://andthenamansaidit.wordpress.com/", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-12T19:46:44.060858+00:00", "id": "UUMrdPfREeeMWfPbEK-0mA", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/UUMrdPfREeeMWfPbEK-0mA/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/UUMrdPfREeeMWfPbEK-0mA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/UUMrdPfREeeMWfPbEK-0mA"}, "user": "acct:spruys@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[3]/div[2]/div[1]/p[10]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[3]/div[2]/div[1]/p[10]", "endOffset": 144, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4541, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4685}, {"suffix": "It had all started with 9/11. I ", "prefix": "SnapChat, no Viber, no WhatsApp.", "exact": "Instead, there was the web, and on the web, there were blogs: the best place to find alternative thoughts, news and analysis. They were my life.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-12T04:39:08.588813+00:00", "text": "What is being shown to us perpetuates our views. This is interesting in regards to the election, for instance. We're bombarded with info on Facebook about where our "friends" are aligned. Yet, it's likely that the views we're being shown, based on algorithms, are very similar to our own. We're not being shown any outside perspectives. This is also interesting in regards to what was said at the symposium about discoverability and how algorithms are created based on what we like. This way, we can receive suggestions similar to what we have previously liked. However, the power of spontaneous discoverability becomes nonexistent at this point. How DO we escape Google's empire?", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-12T04:39:08.588825+00:00", "id": "AVI0IWA88sFu_DXLVa7P", "uri": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:gilliancott@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:gilliancott@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:gilliancott@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVI0IWA88sFu_DXLVa7P/medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVI0IWA88sFu_DXLVa7P", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVI0IWA88sFu_DXLVa7P"}, "user": "acct:gilliancott@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The Web We Have to Save — Matter — Medium"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://medium.com/matter/the-web-we-have-to-save-2eb1fe15a426", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]/a[1]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/article[1]/main[1]/section[4]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]", "endOffset": 246, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 14550, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 14796}, {"suffix": "

title: Kottke, Jason. 2013, December. The blog is dead, long live the blog. NiemanLab.
resp:
[{"created": "2018-01-15T11:37:00.745062+00:00", "text": "It is clear, the blog cannot offer many of the features that these apps grant their users, not to mention other costs in time and money involved. In an age of where "open access" is confused with a widespread sense of  "I want / I deserve"  with the less effort possible. This in turn makes me wonder what drives people to post anything anyway. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T11:41:43.743152+00:00", "id": "ZrD5WvnoEeelrx8fcdP2eg", "uri": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Octavio_West"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/ZrD5WvnoEeelrx8fcdP2eg/www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/ZrD5WvnoEeelrx8fcdP2eg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/ZrD5WvnoEeelrx8fcdP2eg"}, "user": "acct:Octavio_West@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The blog is dead, long live the blog"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content_div-91862", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[2]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[2]", "endOffset": 194, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3460, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3654}, {"suffix": "In 1997, wired teens created onl", "prefix": "e but also decidedly not blogs.
", "exact": "Instead of blogging, people are posting to Tumblr, tweeting, pinning things to their board, posting to Reddit, Snapchatting, updating Facebook statuses, Instagramming, and publishing on Medium. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-15T05:13:32.256473+00:00", "text": "The article was published in 2013, but this line is perhaps even more salient now in 2018 with the US clamoring over the end of net neutrality. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-15T05:13:32.256473+00:00", "id": "1JPZKPmyEeeQgzupwqzpiw", "uri": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1JPZKPmyEeeQgzupwqzpiw/www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/1JPZKPmyEeeQgzupwqzpiw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/1JPZKPmyEeeQgzupwqzpiw"}, "user": "acct:tmcgrath@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The blog is dead, long live the blog"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content_div-91862", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[6]", "startOffset": 509, "endContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[6]", "endOffset": 517, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 6252, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6260}, {"suffix": ", the death of which would be a ", "prefix": "t, cry about the decline of the ", "exact": "open web", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-13T04:32:10.466423+00:00", "text": "I agree. It is not that blog is dead, or that blogging is no longer an activity worth doing outside Facebooking, Instagramming and Tweeting, or that bloggers are no longer exist. I would say that blog, blogging and blogger are expanding. They just exist in different platform (like Facebook and Pinterest), with different method (people who rant on Facebook .. isn't that blogging?) and as different people (Instagrammers, Facebookers, etc). ", "tags": ["blog", "blogging", "blogger", "wordpress", "blogspot"], "updated": "2018-01-13T04:41:19.621825+00:00", "id": "uIpLFvgaEeeqiG9gAviGJw", "uri": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/uIpLFvgaEeeqiG9gAviGJw/www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/uIpLFvgaEeeqiG9gAviGJw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/uIpLFvgaEeeqiG9gAviGJw"}, "user": "acct:aleenadeandra@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The blog is dead, long live the blog"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content_div-91862", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[6]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[6]", "endOffset": 443, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5743, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6186}, {"suffix": " If you want something to cry ab", "prefix": "raffic comes in from elsewhere.
", "exact": "So, R.I.P. The Blog, 1997-2013. But this isn’t cause for lament. The Stream might be on the wane but still it dominates. All media on the web and in mobile apps has blog DNA in it and will continue to for a long while. Over the past 16 years, the blog format has evolved, had social grafted onto it, and mutated into Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest and those new species have now taken over. No biggie, that’s how technology and culture work.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-01-13T02:28:16.706275+00:00", "text": "Facebook actually just announced major changes to the way the News Feed works on January 12 (http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-42657621). 

Paraphrasing Zuckerberg, the article said, "Facebook is to change how its news feed works, making posts from businesses, brands and media less prominent. Instead, content that sparks conversations among family and friends who use the site will be emphasised."", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-01-13T02:28:16.706275+00:00", "id": "aZzPgPgJEeeCS1PwWI4AUg", "uri": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:spruys@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/aZzPgPgJEeeCS1PwWI4AUg/www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/aZzPgPgJEeeCS1PwWI4AUg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/aZzPgPgJEeeCS1PwWI4AUg"}, "user": "acct:spruys@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["The blog is dead, long live the blog"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.niemanlab.org/2013/12/the-blog-is-dead/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content_div-91862", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[5]", "startOffset": 329, "endContainer": "/div[6]/div[1]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[5]", "endOffset": 406, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5296, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5373}, {"suffix": " Pinterest, Digg, and an increas", "prefix": "rigal calls it “a passing fog.” ", "exact": "Facebook’s News Feed is increasingly organized by importance, not chronology.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}]

title: Multiple authors. 2018. Welcome to the post-text future. NYTimes.
resp:
[{"created": "2018-02-15T17:57:36.841168+00:00", "text": "I completely agree and I feel as if this is resulting in a less personal approach of contacting individuals. My older family members have made snapchats thinking this is the only way to contact me, when in reality I would love a phone call from them. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-15T17:57:36.841168+00:00", "id": "tM75YhJ5EeiS_NtAAsBJBA", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/z1KloBHiEeikTw9Ey3kr6A/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/tM75YhJ5EeiS_NtAAsBJBA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/tM75YhJ5EeiS_NtAAsBJBA"}, "user": "acct:julesu@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["z1KloBHiEeikTw9Ey3kr6A"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html"}]}, {"created": "2018-02-15T17:54:39.854730+00:00", "text": "This one sentence relates the two, text and print, as opposed to juxtaposing them like the rest of the article is. By listing the pros and cons of both of the forms of text one can gain a better grasp of how important they both are. The line "nothing online ever really dies" is very powerful since everything we do now is basically online.   ", "exact": "Your phone buzzes. A message, an Instagram post, a tweet — some bit of digital effluvia has come in, and it’s right there, promising a brief but necessary hit of connection. All you have to do is look.
But, just as an experiment, how long can you resist looking? A minute? Two? If you make it that long, how do you start to feel? Can you concentrate? Does your mind wander at what you’re missing? ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-13T04:57:42.057275+00:00", "text": "This is a powerful statement that makes you realize the problem of social media. Even on my dorm floor, there are memes hung up on the walls.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-13T04:57:42.057275+00:00", "id": "bDkQHBB6EeixWLtg-sW6lg", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/bDkQHBB6EeixWLtg-sW6lg/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/bDkQHBB6EeixWLtg-sW6lg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/bDkQHBB6EeixWLtg-sW6lg"}, "user": "acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]", "startOffset": 172, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]", "endOffset": 249, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 53291, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 53368}, {"suffix": " (Remind you of anyone?) And wil", "prefix": "rizes emotion over rationality. ", "exact": "It’s a world where slogans and memes have more sticking power than arguments.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-13T04:53:06.516334+00:00", "text": "This really resonates with me and how I have observed the amount of time my younger cousins spend on youtube. It blows my mind that they (and even people my age) can sit and watch videos about video games and other such things for so long. Who knows what younger kids could come across on accident that could influence them in a negative way?", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-13T04:53:06.516334+00:00", "id": "x-sZGhB5EeihoN8XLbvKZQ", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/x-sZGhB5EeihoN8XLbvKZQ/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/x-sZGhB5EeihoN8XLbvKZQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/x-sZGhB5EeihoN8XLbvKZQ"}, "user": "acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]", "startOffset": 274, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[18]", "endOffset": 375, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 53393, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 53494}, {"suffix": " Are you afraid to find out?

  ", "prefix": "uments. (Remind you of anyone?) ", "exact": "And will someone please think of the children: Do you know how much power YouTube has over your kids?", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-13T04:45:44.456621+00:00", "text": "This relates to the fact that people are becoming less patient, in that when they want something they better get it right away... a lot of people think reading takes to long and is boring so they turn to things such as these advances in technology. It seems as if people are not even patient enough to search something on the internet, hence Siri and Alexa.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-13T04:45:44.456621+00:00", "id": "wG8aNBB4EeiGHnvuO3kmOw", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/wG8aNBB4EeiGHnvuO3kmOw/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/wG8aNBB4EeiGHnvuO3kmOw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/wG8aNBB4EeiGHnvuO3kmOw"}, "user": "acct:Paige_Sevald17@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[5]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[5]", "endOffset": 87, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 48984, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 49071}, {"suffix": "

    ", "exact": "These advances are all about cameras, microphones, your voice, your ears and your eyes.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-13T03:33:11.414960+00:00", "text": "author is directly speaking to the reader. ", "prefix": " 
      
    
  



  
    
    ", "exact": "I’ll make this short: The thing you’re doing now, reading prose on a screen, is going out of fashion.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-13T02:47:57.605656+00:00", "text": "The comparison of social media's power in building a relationship to art is very interesting ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-13T02:47:57.605656+00:00", "id": "TD3VXBBoEeiffGcmi1ZUbA", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:julesu@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/TD3VXBBoEeiffGcmi1ZUbA/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/TD3VXBBoEeiffGcmi1ZUbA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/TD3VXBBoEeiffGcmi1ZUbA"}, "user": "acct:julesu@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[14]", "startOffset": 70, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[14]", "endOffset": 89, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 51754, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 51773}, {"suffix": " Look at all the room the intern", "prefix": " makes for a fundamentally new, ", "exact": "deeper kind of art.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-12T02:47:20.811805+00:00", "text": "Ultimately, text is going to have to make ROOM for other democratized forms of multimodal communication, all of which must now be considered "writing."  The term "post-text" is a little dramatic and sensational. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-12T02:47:20.811805+00:00", "id": "C-XKsA-fEeiMsX-3PzZyLA", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/C-XKsA-fEeiMsX-3PzZyLA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/C-XKsA-fEeiMsX-3PzZyLA"}, "user": "acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA"], "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html"}]}, {"created": "2018-02-11T22:26:03.015794+00:00", "text": "Decreases the credibility of those blogging. ", "exact": "Podcasting became something like the new blogging, a way for committed amateurs and obsessives to plumb the underexplored eddies and mysteries of life. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-11T22:24:50.602276+00:00", "text": "Technology is advancing very quickly which I believe can be dangerous. Are the consequences not addressed as much?", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-11T22:24:50.602276+00:00", "id": "YBVlSA96Eei05oebjinb2Q", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/YBVlSA96Eei05oebjinb2Q/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/YBVlSA96Eei05oebjinb2Q", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/YBVlSA96Eei05oebjinb2Q"}, "user": "acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 244, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 503, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 50571, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 50830}, {"suffix": "

Weeks later, Pinterest introduced just such an app; along with Google, the social network is developing software to identify any visual object.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-11T22:23:09.128765+00:00", "text": "But there is already miscommunication that occurs between texting. Would it be easier to read tone and emotion or more confusing?", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-11T22:23:09.128765+00:00", "id": "I5ekKA96Eeik7Ofje9e3Nw", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/I5ekKA96Eeik7Ofje9e3Nw/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/I5ekKA96Eeik7Ofje9e3Nw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/I5ekKA96Eeik7Ofje9e3Nw"}, "user": "acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[8]", "startOffset": 147, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[8]", "endOffset": 195, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 49745, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 49793}, {"suffix": "

    
    
    
    
    
    
", "prefix": " recedes to the background, and ", "exact": "sounds and images become the universal language.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-11T22:21:00.978913+00:00", "text": "Can the decline of actual texting be a positive or negative technological advancement? Since topics/writings will be more open to interpretations because audio and video offer a less direct message....is this a good thing?", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-11T22:21:00.978913+00:00", "id": "1zQcYA95Eei1XstXDNpPWA", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/1zQcYA95Eei1XstXDNpPWA/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/1zQcYA95Eei1XstXDNpPWA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/1zQcYA95Eei1XstXDNpPWA"}, "user": "acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "startOffset": 245, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]", "endOffset": 372, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 48021, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 48148}, {"suffix": "

    
    
    
    
    
    
", "prefix": "nline, one truth becomes clear. ", "exact": "The defining narrative of our online moment concerns the decline of text, and the exploding reach and power of audio and video.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-11T22:18:32.646558+00:00", "text": "statement of a claim; the writer hooks the reader immediately by applying our experience of reading the article to his overall purpose", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-11T22:18:32.646558+00:00", "id": "fsySWg95EeiJBRt68WMdcw", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/fsySWg95EeiJBRt68WMdcw/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/fsySWg95EeiJBRt68WMdcw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/fsySWg95EeiJBRt68WMdcw"}, "user": "acct:jlardiz1@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "endOffset": 101, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 47635, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 47736}, {"suffix": "
We’re taking stock of the inter", "prefix": "

         
      
    
  



  ", "exact": "I’ll make this short: The thing you’re doing now, reading prose on a screen, is going out of fashion.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-09T22:45:12.913600+00:00", "text": "It's notable that this article uses alphabetic text to announce the death of text, interspersed with images/videos that are cool, but could never convey the complexity that these text paragraphs do.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-09T22:45:12.913600+00:00", "id": "48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA", "uri": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA/www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/48XOyA3qEeiSMQ_4gSi-aA"}, "user": "acct:bsolomo2@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Welcome to the Post-Text Future"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/09/technology/the-rise-of-a-visual-internet.html"}]}]

title: Shatzkin. Words-to-be-read are losing ground to words-to-be-heard, a new stage of digital content evolution. The Shatzkin Files.
Chimero, Frank. 2018. The Good Room. frankchimero.com
