title: Kolbert, Elizabeth. 2017. Who Owns the Internet? The New Yorker.
Hempel, Jessi. 2016. Medium takes aim at WordPress with a new way to power websites. Wired.
resp:
[{"created": "2016-10-25T06:31:22.859108+00:00", "text": "Again, I feel that technological advances have not permanently damaged the publishing industry, but have created new platforms and demanded creative adaptation - and growth is good!", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T06:31:22.859108+00:00", "id": "pcTKnpp8EeasQzufnVgWtA", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/pcTKnpp8EeasQzufnVgWtA/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/pcTKnpp8EeasQzufnVgWtA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/pcTKnpp8EeasQzufnVgWtA"}, "user": "acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[8]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[8]", "endOffset": 265, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5065, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5330}, {"suffix": ". “Across the board, 30 percent ", "prefix": "ey’re great at,” says Williams.
", "exact": "Williams is trying to position Medium as a third way—a platform that can bring the benefits that come with large audiences while also allowing publishers the autonomy to preserve and build their brands and manage their own relationships with readers and advertisers", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T06:27:36.160244+00:00", "text": "I wonder if the presence of short, entertaining stories we see on BuzzFeed through Facebook has a negative correlation with the public/s desire to seek out more reading material? I feel like that may be the case for me.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T06:27:36.160244+00:00", "id": "HqUIEpp8EeahLeNyri24IA", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/HqUIEpp8EeahLeNyri24IA/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/HqUIEpp8EeahLeNyri24IA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/HqUIEpp8EeahLeNyri24IA"}, "user": "acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[5]", "startOffset": 348, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[5]", "endOffset": 548, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3772, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3972}, {"suffix": "
From the start, Williams has en", "prefix": "rs to reach audiences directly. ", "exact": "What’s more, they’re competing with viral experts like BuzzFeed—not necessarily on the ideas they’re covering, but on their ability to game Facebook’s social algorithms in their favor to reach people.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T06:22:05.248323+00:00", "text": "I've noticed this type of strategy being used by some YouTubers through their sponsored Patreon accounts. By paying a monthly donation, I was given access to locked videos, pre-released footage, and even art galleries that were related to the content of the YouTube channel's videos (in this case it was video game lore). ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T06:22:05.248323+00:00", "id": "WWuFgJp7EeaaoNNBPfmndg", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/WWuFgJp7EeaaoNNBPfmndg/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/WWuFgJp7EeaaoNNBPfmndg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/WWuFgJp7EeaaoNNBPfmndg"}, "user": "acct:ML90@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 414, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 518, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7215, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7319}, {"suffix": " Readers will pay Medium directl", "prefix": " and take a cut of the profits. ", "exact": "The startup also plans to let publishers offer paid membership for members-only content and other perks.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T04:27:30.808816+00:00", "text": "This seems to be a positive but with numbers that large I question how many outside views some of these sites are getting. 30% seems like a big percentage but it comes down to total views and their source. How much attention are these pages really getting 3/10 views is still 30%.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T04:27:30.808816+00:00", "id": "V_UlGJprEeaGkr94FGqVjg", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/V_UlGJprEeaGkr94FGqVjg/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/V_UlGJprEeaGkr94FGqVjg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/V_UlGJprEeaGkr94FGqVjg"}, "user": "acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[8]", "startOffset": 267, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[8]", "endOffset": 355, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5332, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5420}, {"suffix": "he says. That could provide publ", "prefix": "s with readers and advertisers. ", "exact": "“Across the board, 30 percent of all page views on Medium are driven by Medium itself,” ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T04:22:59.501732+00:00", "text": "If this can actually deliver on this promise this would be a huge boon to small website producers. As someone who has worked to create a small website in the past this was a huge demand of my time and effort. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T04:22:59.501732+00:00", "id": "tjYP2ppqEeahIa_OyWGF5Q", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/tjYP2ppqEeahIa_OyWGF5Q/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/tjYP2ppqEeahIa_OyWGF5Q", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/tjYP2ppqEeahIa_OyWGF5Q"}, "user": "acct:SeanSliman@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 179, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 342, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3260, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3423}, {"suffix": "
Even two years ago, most publis", "prefix": "r Publishers will allow them to ", "exact": "focus their energy on creative work, rather than trying to master ever-evolving tricks, viral strategies, and social services involved in reaching their audiences.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T03:40:32.001773+00:00", "text": "How about creating an social media account (Facebook and Twitter) to reach audiences a lot easier? Publishers can summarize their book in the newsfeed (I think Twitter has limited word counts, probably 300?) and make a link to their site for readers who would like to find out more. I think appealing their name in social media will help them to showcase their book easily. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T03:40:32.001773+00:00", "id": "x86UXJpkEeac2dOGgq_y4Q", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/x86UXJpkEeac2dOGgq_y4Q/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/x86UXJpkEeac2dOGgq_y4Q", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/x86UXJpkEeac2dOGgq_y4Q"}, "user": "acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[5]", "startOffset": 170, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[5]", "endOffset": 347, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3596, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3773}, {"suffix": " What’s more, they’re competing ", "prefix": "ne to their readers on the web. ", "exact": "But as more readers find stories via social networks like Facebook rather than individual sites’ homepages, it’s growing harder for those publishers to reach audiences directly.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T23:44:27.853107+00:00", "text": "From what I understand, this is like on Buzzfeed where you will often stumble across articles built around promoting a sponsorship product. For example, something like *5 Ways to Wash Your Windows Better* that suggests using a certain brand's product. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T23:44:27.853107+00:00", "id": "zU8nWppDEeabaZv7QRyR7g", "uri": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/zU8nWppDEeabaZv7QRyR7g/www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/zU8nWppDEeabaZv7QRyR7g", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/zU8nWppDEeabaZv7QRyR7g"}, "user": "acct:fxz@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Medium Takes Aim at WordPress With a New Way to Power Websites"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.wired.com/2016/04/medium-now-way-power-entire-sites-including-ads/", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "start-of-content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 149, "endContainer": "/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/article[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 250, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 6947, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7048}, {"suffix": " This ad product launches in bet", "prefix": "sales strategies it will offer: ", "exact": "Publishers can also opt in to host promoted posts, in which a brand sponsors a post on a Medium feed.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T23:37:27.583112+00:00", "text": "It seems ever since social media became the norm, everyone is still trying to figure out how to provide and manage content all in one place. Facebook is no longer just a way to keep in touch with friends, but a multi-functional platform used to keep track of and to access many things. I wonder how much more it will evolve to accommodate different areas of life. ", "exact": "Infrastructures increasingly shape the patterns of media distribution and how media appear, as well as shaping the practices of archivists working with media and the construction of legitimized institutional knowledge in preservation institutions. By their nature, social institutions work to stabilize and reproduce particular practices and forms of knowledge. In a sense, institutions are social infrastructures in themselves. Technical infrastructures are intertwined with the social infrastructures of institutions, often times mediated by standards, protocols, documents and artifacts that bind social and technical aspects of infrastructure.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-12T15:58:04.348412+00:00", "text": "which one is this?", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-12T15:58:04.348412+00:00", "id": "gqZZHBANEei3xSNb7dNxpg", "uri": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/7263/5769", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:shackney06@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:shackney06@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:shackney06@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/gqZZHBANEei3xSNb7dNxpg/journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/7263/5769", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/gqZZHBANEei3xSNb7dNxpg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/gqZZHBANEei3xSNb7dNxpg"}, "user": "acct:shackney06@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Fifty shades of open"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/7263/5769", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[30]/em[1]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[30]", "endOffset": 538, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 24547, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 24568}, {"suffix": "); historical-genealogical studi", "prefix": "yes with media infrastructures (", "exact": "e.g., Mackenzie, 2010", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-02-03T17:47:45.395052+00:00", "text": "I find this idea of documenting "reality" a bit troubling. Archives serve purposes, and if we aren't explicit about these  purposes, and instead simply talk about how effectively they document reality we're not doing our job.

Lynch claims to be offering up "pragmatic" approaches several times in this piece. But the key measure of pragmatism (in the [philosophical sense](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pragmatism)) is the degree to which something is *useful*. Documenting reality is not a use. What purposes does the documentation need to serve *right now*.

I'm as guilty as anyone for pointing to the future and imagining some user who will want to know that something happened. But it's just not a satisfying story to tell.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-02-03T18:13:57.619616+00:00", "id": "V6tUkgkKEeisp58n4g_B_g", "uri": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/8097/6583", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Ed Summers"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/V6tUkgkKEeisp58n4g_B_g/journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/8097/6583", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/V6tUkgkKEeisp58n4g_B_g", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/V6tUkgkKEeisp58n4g_B_g"}, "user": "acct:edsu@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Fifty shades of open"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/8097/6583", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[7]", "startOffset": 1030, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[7]", "endOffset": 1213, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4714, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4897}, {"suffix": "

Further, while some relatively", "prefix": "e. They are different problems. ", "exact": "By “document” here, I mean to capture a comprehensive record, or at least a good approximation, of the present reality that can be consulted today and brought forward into the future.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-07-05T13:08:18.571127+00:00", "text": "Information power can be used by a variety of actors, including those that may use that power in ways that are at odds with the organizational goals of the platform.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-07-05T13:08:18.571135+00:00", "id": "ir4zZkKxEea3U18z2M2UOA", "uri": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Ed Summers"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/ir4zZkKxEea3U18z2M2UOA/journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/ir4zZkKxEea3U18z2M2UOA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/ir4zZkKxEea3U18z2M2UOA"}, "user": "acct:edsu@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Fifty shades of open"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[71]", "startOffset": 1048, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[71]", "endOffset": 1320, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 45285, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 45557}, {"suffix": "

Further, other users’ access t", "prefix": "power than someone who had not. ", "exact": "However, if Twitter does not prominently describe how its Trending Topic algorithm works, then Zelda’s informational power is entirely dependent on the accuracy of other sources she may (or may not) have used to build her understanding of the information flows on Twitter.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-07-05T12:01:16.904367+00:00", "text": "Being able to recognize choices that can be made, and being able to make them is an elegantly simple indicator of information power.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-07-05T12:01:16.904375+00:00", "id": "LaLhTkKoEea1zqNAuTZyOw", "uri": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:edsu@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Ed Summers"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/LaLhTkKoEea1zqNAuTZyOw/journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/LaLhTkKoEea1zqNAuTZyOw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/LaLhTkKoEea1zqNAuTZyOw"}, "user": "acct:edsu@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Fifty shades of open"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6793/5523", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[64]", "startOffset": 752, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[64]", "endOffset": 1111, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 38332, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 38691}, {"suffix": "

Changes in the information flo", "prefix": "e just as they had been before. ", "exact": "What is important is that access to information about how this part of the platform works creates the possibility for the individual to make a choice. Choice creates the possibility for the expression of informational power. These possibilities are closed off when users do not have the basis of informational power from which to enter these fields of action.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-05-11T18:06:45.115062+00:00", "text": "in line with the Barth definition", "tags": ["open"], "updated": "2016-05-11T18:06:45.115075+00:00", "id": "AVSg_-N6FtPwhMO7DmAH", "uri": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6360/5460", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:phb256@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:phb256@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:phb256@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Paul Bond"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVSg_-N6FtPwhMO7DmAH/journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6360/5460", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVSg_-N6FtPwhMO7DmAH", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVSg_-N6FtPwhMO7DmAH"}, "user": "acct:phb256@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Fifty shades of open"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://journals.uic.edu/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/6360/5460", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "content", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[59]", "startOffset": 622, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[3]/blockquote[2]/p[59]", "endOffset": 998, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 32413, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 32789}, {"suffix": " A MOOC of this stripe is now mo", "prefix": "es, 2011). In other words, this ", "exact": "first MOOC was open in the sense articulated by the Open Education Consortium: knowledge, insights, and information were shared between students, and new knowledge, skills, ideas, and understanding built through sharing. resp: [{"created": "2016-10-25T06:20:32.240282+00:00", "text": "I think this is a good explanation and relates to the earlier point of authors creating for art as opposed to profit. It is unlikely that an author enters the industry with the expectation of baking huge bank on their work. This, in my opinion, leads to unmediated written content, which is the point of fiction, isn't it?", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T06:20:32.240282+00:00", "id": "IgL1Qpp7Eeakus_XZGDZtg", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/IgL1Qpp7Eeakus_XZGDZtg/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/IgL1Qpp7Eeakus_XZGDZtg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/IgL1Qpp7Eeakus_XZGDZtg"}, "user": "acct:hjorgens@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[25]", "startOffset": 541, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[25]", "endOffset": 790, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 10737, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 10986}, {"suffix": ".", "exact": "A photo of Stephen King reading this\u00a0article", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T05:25:34.383125+00:00", "text": "It's a bold statement here to say \"rarely produces anything good\", Publishers can't honestly agree with that. We spoke about this in class where art such as music can have a certain formula that matches the best selling sounds of a particular genre. In the case of books, there are certain elements of bestsellers that simply cannot be ignored if writers are on a quest to sell a lot of copies. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T05:25:34.383125+00:00", "id": "dEa2cJpzEeaktIds27LXag", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ML90@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/dEa2cJpzEeaktIds27LXag", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/dEa2cJpzEeaktIds27LXag"}, "user": "acct:ML90@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q"], "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d"}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T23:27:27.662471+00:00", "text": "Media could also lie. When the human ego merges with social media, there seems to be no limit to the level of nonsense that people will create. We\u2019re at a period in time where numbers can mean so much and simultaneously mean so little. Living in an age where numbers are easily manipulated, it will be a challenge for people to find out the 'real' number of readers/followers.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T04:49:46.880448+00:00", "id": "bUFXcppBEeadU8-iGIiKkA", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/bUFXcppBEeadU8-iGIiKkA/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/bUFXcppBEeadU8-iGIiKkA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/bUFXcppBEeadU8-iGIiKkA"}, "user": "acct:eccoor@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[13]", "startOffset": 21, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[13]", "endOffset": 137, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4854, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4970}, {"suffix": ": brag about their sales while c", "prefix": " returns.\u201d)While this is basic, ", "exact": "it\u2019s surprisingly common for authors and publishers to either intentionally or unintentionally confuse these numbers", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T03:29:58.879100+00:00", "text": "I think media plays a significant role in this. When I watch a reality show in Korea, where it shows one celebrity's daily lifestyle and the colouring book was introduced as her hobby. The colouring book is greatly known after and it brought a huge influence in bookstore in Korea. The sales of colouring book has increased enormously. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T03:29:58.879100+00:00", "id": "TmzcUJpjEeamzSdTNzxvNg", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/TmzcUJpjEeamzSdTNzxvNg/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/TmzcUJpjEeamzSdTNzxvNg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/TmzcUJpjEeamzSdTNzxvNg"}, "user": "acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "a519", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[31]", "startOffset": 368, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[31]", "endOffset": 428, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 13257, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 13317}, {"suffix": ". (I mean, adult coloring books?", "prefix": "0k, 100k, and 10k respectively. ", "exact": "Publishing is full of luck, timing, and unpredictable trends", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-25T03:22:23.946143+00:00", "text": "I disagree. Writing for the market means a book is written based on current market trends. You're right that as a writer, selling books is a big part of their job. However, it is a calculated approach, which writers' goal moves toward financial benefits. This might restrain their instinct creativity and innovative ideas when writing books.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-25T03:22:23.946143+00:00", "id": "Pzve5JpiEea2YlPJnoUN9w", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Pzve5JpiEea2YlPJnoUN9w", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Pzve5JpiEea2YlPJnoUN9w"}, "user": "acct:jkyungmin_@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "references": ["YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg"], "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d"}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T23:39:58.426408+00:00", "text": "Right. It really depends on which genre of the book. Different kinds of book has different marketing position, thus are distributed via different (or special) channels. Of course, Bookstore as one of the traditional sale channels is still an important sale channel.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T23:39:58.426408+00:00", "id": "LLdoFppDEeaaZ0e7Ol9Eug", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/LLdoFppDEeaaZ0e7Ol9Eug/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/LLdoFppDEeaaZ0e7Ol9Eug", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/LLdoFppDEeaaZ0e7Ol9Eug"}, "user": "acct:eccoor@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "d9a1", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[19]", "startOffset": 362, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[19]", "endOffset": 761, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7152, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7551}, {"suffix": " BookScan misses all of that.Las", "prefix": ", and that may be true overall. ", "exact": "For a popular literary fiction title, for which library sales or hand sales are a tiny percentage, BookScan is probably getting at least 75% or more of print sales. For other types of books, BookScan might record as little as 25% of print sales. Small press books, for example, can sell most of their copies at conferences, book festivals, and direct sales on the publisher\u2019s website or at readings.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T22:56:11.042920+00:00", "text": "However, I think there's a limit to how much marketing would affect the actual creative process. Also, I think the author is addressing a counterpoint about remaining true to the creative process, and then is responding to that counterpoint with the idea that it's always better to be informed about how book sales work. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T22:56:11.042920+00:00", "id": "DqM5tJo9EeaaYE_9aFolLg", "uri": publishers would think about this. Also, with the tracking of reader habits, would sales and reader data start to change the way writers produce content more often?", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T22:46:45.055000+00:00", "id": "vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:fxz@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/vVKl0po7EeaMm2t8lGjZ9Q"}, "user": "acct:fxz@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "a85b", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]", "startOffset": 289, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]", "endOffset": 359, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2169, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2239}, {"suffix": " But I\u2019m still na\u00efve enough to t", "prefix": "an eye toward art, not markets. ", "exact": "Thinking about sales while creating art rarely produces anything good.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T21:32:37.872528+00:00", "text": "Disagreed. Writing is creative, powerful, and inspiring stuff. Marketing is, at best, utilitarian. However, writers absolutely need marketing. you know you are a writer because you love to write. As a writer, you love thinking about writing and having people read your writing. And, more importantly, you\u2019d love to get paid to write. What's more, we are now living in an age of online writer where the rise of content marketing is rapid and powerful. You won't make money without marketing.\n", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T21:32:37.872528+00:00", "id": "YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/YqB8GJoxEeamkr-L3KX7Dg"}, "user": "acct:eccoor@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "a85b", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]/span[1]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]/span[1]", "endOffset": 68, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2123, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2191}, {"suffix": " Thinking about sales while crea", "prefix": "t $0.00 royalty check comes in? ", "exact": "Writers should absolutely write with an eye toward art, not markets.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-24T21:14:36.848781+00:00", "text": "There has been s number of researches supporting the use of coloring books for pleasure and self-care. Thus, coloring books are frequently described as stress-relieving and branded as art therapy. Coloring has proven surprisingly addictive for people's stressed, anxious, and overworked. Such activity - and its magical effects \" therapeutic without being therapy, meditative without being meditation, creative without being creation, artsy without being art\" - has become a big business. \n", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-10-24T21:14:36.848781+00:00", "id": "3kOTspouEeaqGpsHaP-9Hw", "uri": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:eccoor@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/3kOTspouEeaqGpsHaP-9Hw/electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/3kOTspouEeaqGpsHaP-9Hw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/3kOTspouEeaqGpsHaP-9Hw"}, "user": "acct:eccoor@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Everything You Wanted to Know about Book Sales (But Were Afraid to Ask)"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://electricliterature.com/everything-you-wanted-to-know-about-book-sales-but-were-afraid-to-ask-1fe6bc00aa2d", "selector": [{"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]/a[2]", "startOffset": 18, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/main[1]/article[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[2]/a[2]", "endOffset": 38, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 1624, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 1644}, {"suffix": " and YouTube celebrity memoirs. Hundreds of them. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-08-26T02:00:11.107953+00:00", "text": "I wonder if this can be traced back to learning to read and the emphasis that we had put on comprehension and narrative. Stories require much more attentive reading than what people have now; children were constantly tested on reading a physical piece of paper instead of though online sources. This hypothesis would require more of these observations to be done for students entering into school when screen usage is more prominent. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-08-26T02:00:11.107953+00:00", "id": "w93h_KjTEeiDw6vtbbaEaQ", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:JonJennings@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:JonJennings@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:JonJennings@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/w93h_KjTEeiDw6vtbbaEaQ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/w93h_KjTEeiDw6vtbbaEaQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/w93h_KjTEeiDw6vtbbaEaQ"}, "user": "acct:JonJennings@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "startOffset": 716, "endContainer": "/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "endOffset": 905, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3393, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3582}, {"suffix": "Skimming, Liu concluded, had bec", "prefix": "hat several things had changed. ", "exact": "On screen, people tended to browse and scan, to look for keywords, and to read in a less linear, more selective fashion. On the page, they tended to concentrate more on following the text. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-08-26T01:51:09.203878+00:00", "text": "I was reading an article that said when people read in print they are more likely to engage other sense: the smell of paper, the touch of the book, or the muscle memory of holding a book all work together to create more links for students to remember material. In contrast, the backlit screens hurt peoples' eyes or keep them up (hence why there is night mode on screens) and encourages people to multitask or be otherwise distracted due to resembling a phone or email-type activities when reading. ", "exact": "The tangibility of paper versus the intangibility of something digital.\u201d The contrast of pixels, the layout of the words, the concept of scrolling versus turning a page, the physicality of a book versus the ephemerality of a screen, the ability to hyperlink and move from source to source within seconds online\u2014all these variables translate into a different reading experience.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2018-08-24T21:14:50.540105+00:00", "text": "I was thinking the same thing. I wonder how big of an impact this had.", "tags": [], "updated": "2018-05-27T15:13:10.556398+00:00", "id": "d9UJcGHAEeifK3vCg3U29g", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:kionnaj@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:kionnaj@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:kionnaj@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/d9UJcGHAEeifK3vCg3U29g/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/d9UJcGHAEeifK3vCg3U29g", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/d9UJcGHAEeifK3vCg3U29g"}, "user": "acct:kionnaj@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "startOffset": 654, "endContainer": "/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "endOffset": 739, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 1010, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 1095}, {"suffix": " And there were, of course, the ", "prefix": " that their students exhibited, ", "exact": "missing crucial details because they failed to delve deeply enough into any one case.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:38:21.036407+00:00", "text": "This was a ridiculously good article (that I didn\u2019t skim), but I wish we all had the opportunity to relocate to some small French village. That\u2019s exactly the sort of move that\u2019d foster all sorts of spiritual dedication to reading or writing anything, regardless of the medium. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:38:21.036407+00:00", "id": "85hdLInMEeeLx2viQwBZZA", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/85hdLInMEeeLx2viQwBZZA/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/85hdLInMEeeLx2viQwBZZA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/85hdLInMEeeLx2viQwBZZA"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[14]", "startOffset": 160, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[14]", "endOffset": 177, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 14164, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 14181}, {"suffix": " with shaky mobile reception and", "prefix": "as ensconced herself in a small ", "exact": "village in France", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:36:02.188551+00:00", "text": "This is exactly what I was talking about regarding my daughter. I think this newest generation will be perfectly adapted to online reading. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:36:02.188551+00:00", "id": "oNkt5onMEeeeY8-VE3X-yw", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/oNkt5onMEeeeY8-VE3X-yw/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/oNkt5onMEeeeY8-VE3X-yw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/oNkt5onMEeeeY8-VE3X-yw"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[13]", "startOffset": 367, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[13]", "endOffset": 381, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 13419, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 13433}, {"suffix": " Wolf is now working on digital ", "prefix": "d read deeply. They just had to ", "exact": "be taught how.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:32:16.496136+00:00", "text": "And I think that online sources seem more ephemeral to most people\u2014a book doesn\u2019t go away once you set it down, but a webpage disappears as soon as you click the little \u201cX.\u201d", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:32:16.496136+00:00", "id": "GlmmQonMEeerEg9pxj_MQg", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/GlmmQonMEeerEg9pxj_MQg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/GlmmQonMEeerEg9pxj_MQg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/GlmmQonMEeerEg9pxj_MQg"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[6]", "startOffset": 1063, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[6]", "endOffset": 1083, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7060, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7080}, {"suffix": " mattered for basic comprehensio", "prefix": "imic the printed page\u2014but their ", "exact": "physical materiality", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:29:25.523218+00:00", "text": "Eventually, thanks to the competition that\u2019s generated via capitalism and consumption, I\u2019d imagine that a \u201cbest layout\u201d will eventually be found, and online forums will take on a universal feel, and this \u201cneed for adjustment\u201d might diminish. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:29:25.523218+00:00", "id": "tGu7QInLEeegKY8ItymWPw", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/tGu7QInLEeegKY8ItymWPw/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/tGu7QInLEeegKY8ItymWPw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/tGu7QInLEeegKY8ItymWPw"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[4]", "startOffset": 1277, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[4]", "endOffset": 1291, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4826, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4840}, {"suffix": ". Each adjustment, in turn, take", "prefix": " eyes and your reading approach ", "exact": "need to adjust", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:26:25.222886+00:00", "text": "Not to mention that books don\u2019t have advertisements flashing in the margins, like many websites. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:26:25.222886+00:00", "id": "SPoHronLEeeP8nuuJS0DPg", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/SPoHronLEeeP8nuuJS0DPg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/SPoHronLEeeP8nuuJS0DPg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/SPoHronLEeeP8nuuJS0DPg"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "startOffset": 1058, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "endOffset": 1066, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3540, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3548}, {"suffix": ".The online world, too, tends to", "prefix": "thout stopping to ponder any one", "exact": " thought", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:26:15.432309+00:00", "text": "I think the human mind works better with page breaks, if that makes sense. I always perceive online documents as one page, and I too end up scrolling through them quickly. When you have to turn pages in a book, each flip marks a segment, and I\u2019m more likely to pay attention to things that\u2019re sequestered this way. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:26:15.432309+00:00", "id": "Qxv94onLEeeT5LeIkjYBQg", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/Qxv94onLEeeT5LeIkjYBQg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/Qxv94onLEeeT5LeIkjYBQg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/Qxv94onLEeeT5LeIkjYBQg"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "startOffset": 163, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[3]", "endOffset": 175, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2645, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2657}, {"suffix": ". Online, the tendency is compou", "prefix": " when we move sequentially from ", "exact": "page to page", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:20:52.858657+00:00", "text": "Ha! That\u2019s exactly what I was trying to say in my first annotation, but I didn\u2019t do so as eloquently. And maybe a huge part of this is evolutionary, so to speak. Most people at this scholastic level started with traditional text books and are only now transitioning into reading via electronic mediums. Maybe people like my daughter, who grew up with an electronic foundation, will find it easier to adapt, and maybe they\u2019ll learn with the same proficiency that my generation demonstrated with traditional, paper texts. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:20:52.858657+00:00", "id": "gu35CInKEeefHtuQf9MvDg", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/gu35CInKEeefHtuQf9MvDg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/gu35CInKEeefHtuQf9MvDg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/gu35CInKEeefHtuQf9MvDg"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[2]", "startOffset": 478, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[2]", "endOffset": 599, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2055, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2176}, {"suffix": "\u201d The contrast of pixels, the la", "prefix": "ly acknowledged,\u201d she told me. \u201c", "exact": "The ergonomics, the haptics of the device itself. The tangibility of paper versus the intangibility of something digital.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2017-08-25T19:16:28.174592+00:00", "text": "I wonder if that\u2019s due in part to the physical distance between a reader and the medium. Know what I mean? You can hold and highlight a text book\u2014flip quickly to any part without a battery\u2014and I\u2019ve always felt more of a connection to something I can hold in my hand while I read it. But in a weird way, maybe programs like this one (Hypothes.is) help to breach that barrier. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-08-25T19:16:28.174592+00:00", "id": "5R3E7InJEeeP8Wu_LF-69g", "uri": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/5R3E7InJEeeP8Wu_LF-69g/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/5R3E7InJEeeP8Wu_LF-69g", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/5R3E7InJEeeP8Wu_LF-69g"}, "user": "acct:jjamesanderson@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "https://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "startOffset": 359, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[2]/main[1]/section[1]/article[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]", "endOffset": 369, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 548, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 558}, {"suffix": ". There were the architects who ", "prefix": "ne, the less students seemed to ", "exact": "understand", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-10-18T15:08:38.576462+00:00", "text": "Love the idea that reading, the book, and all associated tools are themselves \"technologies\": like highlighters, for example.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ogezywfzDa0", "tags": [], "updated": "2017-04-04T15:06:21.648876+00:00", "id": "v6hSYJVEEea6Md-NPgJbfQ", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jeremydean@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jeremydean@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jeremydean@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": "Jeremy Dean"}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/v6hSYJVEEea6Md-NPgJbfQ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/v6hSYJVEEea6Md-NPgJbfQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/v6hSYJVEEea6Md-NPgJbfQ"}, "user": "acct:jeremydean@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader -
