You have to have self control and be able to pay attention and no just read but rather comprehend.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-09-29T03:32:07.626187+00:00", "id": "THMkcoX1EeafXOdv_EWwLA", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/THMkcoX1EeafXOdv_EWwLA/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/THMkcoX1EeafXOdv_EWwLA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/THMkcoX1EeafXOdv_EWwLA"}, "user": "acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[9]", "startOffset": 889, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[9]", "endOffset": 1289, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 11112, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 11512}, {"suffix": " Maybe the decline of deep readi", "prefix": "ly pick up the book,\u201d she says. ", "exact": "\u201cOn the Internet, that monitoring and self-regulation cycle happens again and again. And if you\u2019re the kind of person who\u2019s naturally good at self-monitoring, you don\u2019t have a problem. But if you\u2019re a reader who hasn\u2019t been trained to pay attention, each time you click a link, you\u2019re constructing your own text. And when you\u2019re asked comprehension questions, it\u2019s like you picked up the wrong book.\u201d", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-09-29T03:29:22.933545+00:00", "text": "This is true. I think we get this habit from social media. Think about it, when you scroll through Twitter, Facebook or Instagram do you read every little thing? No, you look for stand out words.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-09-29T03:29:22.933545+00:00", "id": "6kGn2IX0Eea7rj80BqcEpw", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/6kGn2IX0Eea7rj80BqcEpw/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/6kGn2IX0Eea7rj80BqcEpw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/6kGn2IX0Eea7rj80BqcEpw"}, "user": "acct:christinazvorsky@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 175, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4806, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4981}, {"suffix": ". Online, the tendency is compou", "prefix": "a different reading experience. ", "exact": "The screen, for one, seems to encourage more skimming behavior: when we scroll, we tend to read more quickly (and less deeply) than when we move sequentially from page to page", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-28T00:47:55.425684+00:00", "text": "This was part of the appeal to me of the Kindle, the ability to go from within a text and immediately click into a dictionary to look up a word I was unfamiliar with. Or to highlight neatly within the text and look up those specific highlights later on. It was also helpful to have on page in front of me rather than two where I could skip ahead if I wanted. I think it's less a distraction in some instances.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-28T00:47:55.425692+00:00", "id": "DsqA3my5EeaSccdpESr3vQ", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/DsqA3my5EeaSccdpESr3vQ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/DsqA3my5EeaSccdpESr3vQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/DsqA3my5EeaSccdpESr3vQ"}, "user": "acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]", "startOffset": 601, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[3]", "endOffset": 838, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4423, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 4660}, {"suffix": "\u2014all these variables translate i", "prefix": "gibility of something digital.\u201d ", "exact": "The contrast of pixels, the layout of the words, the concept of scrolling versus turning a page, the physicality of a book versus the ephemerality of a screen, the ability to hyperlink and move from source to source within seconds online", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-28T00:42:00.951055+00:00", "text": "I think this is an example of how reliant we become on technology to provide the answer rather than thinking our way through something based on previous experience or other knowledge. It's still an important thing to have critical thinking and problem-solving skills when technology fails us.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-28T00:42:00.951063+00:00", "id": "O4EqcGy4EeaoNYO09wcKaQ", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/O4EqcGy4EeaoNYO09wcKaQ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/O4EqcGy4EeaoNYO09wcKaQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/O4EqcGy4EeaoNYO09wcKaQ"}, "user": "acct:meaganstruve@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "startOffset": 485, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "endOffset": 539, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2917, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2971}, {"suffix": " There were the neurosurgeons wh", "prefix": " ready digital information that ", "exact": "they were unprepared to address basic problems onsite.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-27T19:26:45.225469+00:00", "text": "I wonder if it also has to do with reading environment. When we hold a physical book we usually get more comfortable with it. We curl up on the couch, away from distractions, and make it an event; we wouldn't read a physical book at our desk.So because of this, we may also devote longer periods of time to reading what's in front of us.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-27T19:26:45.225478+00:00", "id": "MNqw1myMEeaoI3dJVqCEhg", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/MNqw1myMEeaoI3dJVqCEhg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/MNqw1myMEeaoI3dJVqCEhg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/MNqw1myMEeaoI3dJVqCEhg"}, "user": "acct:jleonard@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[6]", "startOffset": 524, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[6]", "endOffset": 689, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 7688, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 7853}, {"suffix": " \u201cAnecdotally, I\u2019ve heard some s", "prefix": "onal or nostalgic significance. ", "exact": "People prefer physical books, not out of old-fashioned attachment but because the nature of the object itself has deeper repercussions for reading and comprehension.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-27T19:17:21.767290+00:00", "text": "I find this to be true when I'm reading online articles to learn something specific. I scan the text to see if it will be of value then move on to the next one or decide to focus on that one. Having so many different websites to choose from changes how I read something online verses only having one book in front of me. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-27T19:17:21.767299+00:00", "id": "4QHTdGyKEeanNd-BTX1gRw", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:jleonard@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/4QHTdGyKEeanNd-BTX1gRw/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/4QHTdGyKEeanNd-BTX1gRw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/4QHTdGyKEeanNd-BTX1gRw"}, "user": "acct:jleonard@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 177, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 411, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 4920, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5154}, {"suffix": " When Ziming Liu, a professor at", "prefix": "sequentially from page to page. ", "exact": "Online, the tendency is compounded as a way of coping with an overload of information. There are so many possible sources, so many pages, so many alternatives to any article or book or document that we read more quickly to compensate.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-26T20:36:14.357839+00:00", "text": "It's interesting--the differences in how we interact with words on a screen and on paper. In an interview a while ago I was asked how writing for print and for the internet is different. I think that for the internet, layout is very important and words and titles have to be eye-catching so we can pick things up when we browse and scan. The page has to be easy to navigate quickly. On print it's a much different story. but it just goes to show how important it is to acknowledge the differences when you create online material. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-26T20:36:14.357846+00:00", "id": "u3Ch2mvMEea_u6d_JDOmJQ", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:courtney_k27@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:courtney_k27@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:courtney_k27@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/u3Ch2mvMEea_u6d_JDOmJQ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/u3Ch2mvMEea_u6d_JDOmJQ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/u3Ch2mvMEea_u6d_JDOmJQ"}, "user": "acct:courtney_k27@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 716, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 904, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5526, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5714}, {"suffix": " Skimming, Liu concluded, had be", "prefix": "hat several things had changed. ", "exact": "On screen, people tended to browse and scan, to look for keywords, and to read in a less linear, more selective fashion. On the page, they tended to concentrate more on following the text.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-08-26T03:09:28.455078+00:00", "text": "I've often felt like our education system is becoming too \"cut-and-paste\" as well. If we lose out on a generation of critical thinkers, our society will be in a sorry state. ", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-08-26T03:09:28.455085+00:00", "id": "gDRkaGs6EeaUmtfIFLr8dA", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:bgarcia18@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:bgarcia18@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:bgarcia18@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/gDRkaGs6EeaUmtfIFLr8dA/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/gDRkaGs6EeaUmtfIFLr8dA", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/gDRkaGs6EeaUmtfIFLr8dA"}, "user": "acct:bgarcia18@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "startOffset": 591, "endContainer": "/article[1]/div[2]/div[1]/p[1]", "endOffset": 622, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3044, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3075}, {"suffix": " that their students exhibited, ", "prefix": "osurgeons who worried about the ", "exact": "\u201ccut-and-paste chart mentality\u201d", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-05-06T14:19:36.522598+00:00", "text": "", "tags": ["reading online"], "updated": "2016-05-06T14:19:36.522614+00:00", "id": "AVSGcCLOFtPwhMO7DiAL", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVSGcCLOFtPwhMO7DiAL/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVSGcCLOFtPwhMO7DiAL", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVSGcCLOFtPwhMO7DiAL"}, "user": "acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "masthead", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/header[1]/hgroup[1]/h1[1]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/header[1]/hgroup[1]/h1[1]", "endOffset": 28, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 717, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 745}, {"suffix": "\n\n\t\t\t\t\tBy Maria Konnikova\t\t\t\t\t\n\t", "prefix": "\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t July 16, 2014\n\n\t\t\t\t\t", "exact": "Being a Better Online Reader", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-28T17:18:04.923486+00:00", "text": "This is very true to me, I find it far easier to be distracted when reading online than in a book. When reading from a book there is nothing else in front of you to be distracted with. When using a computer there are countless other programs to distract you.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-28T17:18:04.923498+00:00", "id": "AVKJPfR1vTW_3w8LykoL", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Austpuch@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Austpuch@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Austpuch@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKJPfR1vTW_3w8LykoL/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKJPfR1vTW_3w8LykoL", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKJPfR1vTW_3w8LykoL"}, "user": "acct:Austpuch@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[3]", "startOffset": 419, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[3]", "endOffset": 464, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 2715, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 2760}, {"suffix": "she told me. \u201cThe ergonomics, th", "prefix": "r or even a bound book. Reading ", "exact": "\u201cinvolves factors not usually acknowledged,\u201d ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-28T03:50:00.968539+00:00", "text": "Reading a book allows you to physically acknowledge and hold what you have finished reading; it's less satisfying to finish reading on a screen than it is to finish reading a book.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-28T03:50:00.968552+00:00", "id": "AVKGWiYQvTW_3w8LykLZ", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKGWiYQvTW_3w8LykLZ/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKGWiYQvTW_3w8LykLZ", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKGWiYQvTW_3w8LykLZ"}, "user": "acct:ehubert@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[6]", "startOffset": 338, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[6]", "endOffset": 523, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5961, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 6146}, {"suffix": " People prefer physical books, n", "prefix": "t broader processing abilities. ", "exact": "One of her main hypotheses is that the physical presence of a book\u2014its heft, its feel, the weight and order of its pages\u2014may have more than a purely emotional or nostalgic significance.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-28T03:45:42.760053+00:00", "text": "I never realized how much 'work' it takes for our eyes to read on screens, but it makes sense as to why reading online makes many people's eyes hurt.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-28T03:45:42.760066+00:00", "id": "AVKGVjVwvTW_3w8LykLT", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKGVjVwvTW_3w8LykLT/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKGVjVwvTW_3w8LykLT", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKGVjVwvTW_3w8LykLT"}, "user": "acct:ehubert@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[5]", "startOffset": 1293, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[5]", "endOffset": 1352, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 5563, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 5622}, {"suffix": " The shift from print to digital", "prefix": "eading approach need to adjust. ", "exact": "Each adjustment, in turn, takes mental and physical energy.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-28T03:42:15.659301+00:00", "text": "Very true", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-28T03:42:15.659313+00:00", "id": "AVKGUwxovTW_3w8LykLD", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKGUwxovTW_3w8LykLD/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKGUwxovTW_3w8LykLD", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKGUwxovTW_3w8LykLD"}, "user": "acct:ehubert@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "startOffset": 0, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[4]", "endOffset": 62, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 3202, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 3264}, {"suffix": ": when we scroll, we tend to rea", "prefix": "a different reading experience. ", "exact": "The screen, for one, seems to encourage more skimming behavior", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-28T03:32:29.754218+00:00", "text": "I can agree with this- not only do I prefer a paper copy so I can physically hold my reading, but I find that it tends to be easier for me to follow and understand as well when it's on paper vs online.", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-28T03:32:29.754229+00:00", "id": "AVKGShvCvTW_3w8LykKx", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:ehubert@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKGShvCvTW_3w8LykKx/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKGShvCvTW_3w8LykKx", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKGShvCvTW_3w8LykKx"}, "user": "acct:ehubert@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1]", "startOffset": 300, "endContainer": "/div[2]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1]", "endOffset": 371, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 1206, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 1277}, {"suffix": "There were the architects who wr", "prefix": "aried, a theme began to emerge: ", "exact": "the more reading moved online, the less students seemed to understand. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-27T23:47:29.912423+00:00", "text": "Thats a very good idea", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-27T23:47:29.912434+00:00", "id": "AVKFfB3wvTW_3w8LykBX", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKFfB3wvTW_3w8LykBX/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKFfB3wvTW_3w8LykBX", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKFfB3wvTW_3w8LykBX"}, "user": "acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader"}]}, {"created": "2016-01-27T23:46:29.922628+00:00", "text": "This surprises me, i can't edit well on a computer i need to print off a paper to edit/revise it", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-27T23:46:29.922642+00:00", "id": "AVKFezOpvTW_3w8LykBR", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKFezOpvTW_3w8LykBR/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKFezOpvTW_3w8LykBR", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKFezOpvTW_3w8LykBR"}, "user": "acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader"}]}, {"created": "2016-01-27T23:45:02.876003+00:00", "text": "The screen setup is only an issue for straining eyes not comprehension, the easy of reading and ability to focus on the reading by not getting distracted online is the actual issue\n", "tags": [], "updated": "2016-01-27T23:45:02.876016+00:00", "id": "AVKFed-TvTW_3w8LykBL", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/AVKFed-TvTW_3w8LykBL/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/AVKFed-TvTW_3w8LykBL", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/AVKFed-TvTW_3w8LykBL"}, "user": "acct:Liamcahill6@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - And ", "exact": "our eyes themselves may grow fatigued from the constantly shifting screens, layouts, colors, and contrasts,", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2016-01-27T21:27:37.307429+00:00", "text": "Just personal experience with a book vs. a kindle or iPad, I would choose a book. Theres just something more satisfying to me about turning a page and feeing the paper. The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader"}]}, {"created": "2015-09-05T02:39:04.344865+00:00", "text": "", "tags": ["reading online", "online reading"], "updated": "2015-09-05T02:39:04.344878+00:00", "id": "CwFUKSAzSZqf64--4fWbig", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/CwFUKSAzSZqf64--4fWbig/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/CwFUKSAzSZqf64--4fWbig", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/CwFUKSAzSZqf64--4fWbig"}, "user": "acct:otterscotter@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader"}]}, {"created": "2015-09-03T04:44:58.072969+00:00", "text": "My hunch is that annotation, whether analog or digital, deepens our connection to the annotated material. Disclosure: I am (1) a person who struggles to resist the temptation to skim or channel-hop when reading in the browser, and (2) the product manager for Hypothesis, the tool we are using to annotate this article. \n\nThe act of annotation requires me to pause, reflect, and inscribe some evidence of my reflection. It is a physical act insofar as I use my hands to create the notes. I suspect, and hope, that this way of interacting with texts will help me resist the distractions of the web and improve the quality of my online reading. In a new study, ", "exact": "the introduction of an interactive annotation component helped", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2015-09-02T20:30:33.685646+00:00", "text": "My question is whether this is something that will need to be taught in the upcoming generation that teethed on iPhones (literally) and received tablets for their second birthdays.", "tags": ["#psutheory", "psutheory"], "updated": "2015-09-02T20:34:00.760324+00:00", "id": "HZXT2RGzRpqUNwVZS2vmOw", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/MWy7xqW1QW-59RK9gLMACg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/HZXT2RGzRpqUNwVZS2vmOw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/HZXT2RGzRpqUNwVZS2vmOw"}, "user": "acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "references": ["MWy7xqW1QW-59RK9gLMACg"], "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader"}]}, {"created": "2015-09-02T20:21:16.342753+00:00", "text": "I wonder how this will differ with our upcoming generation of true digital (and mobile) natives who have had tablets and phones to read on since they were 2 or so. Will they need that training? Will they need more training in reading physical texts?", "tags": ["psutheory"], "updated": "2015-09-02T20:33:44.339559+00:00", "id": "cZl-i5r2Sc2YTyiCrDm5jg", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/cZl-i5r2Sc2YTyiCrDm5jg/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/cZl-i5r2Sc2YTyiCrDm5jg", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/cZl-i5r2Sc2YTyiCrDm5jg"}, "user": "acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[13]", "startOffset": 864, "endContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[13]", "endOffset": 1046, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 14477, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 14659}, {"suffix": " Wolf is optimistic that we can ", "prefix": "wly and gradually than we are.\u201d ", "exact": "Not only should digital reading be introduced more slowly into the curriculum; it also should be integrated with the more immersive reading skills that deeper comprehension requires.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2015-09-02T20:17:45.407619+00:00", "text": "This goes again back to physical connection that seems to be needed to form strong memory.", "tags": ["psutheory"], "updated": "2015-09-02T20:33:30.887784+00:00", "id": "6gnz46YrSTKuWGlrH3Xr6g", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/6gnz46YrSTKuWGlrH3Xr6g/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/6gnz46YrSTKuWGlrH3Xr6g", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/6gnz46YrSTKuWGlrH3Xr6g"}, "user": "acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "startOffset": 501, "endContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[11]", "endOffset": 620, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 12169, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 12288}, {"suffix": " It wasn\u2019t the screen that disru", "prefix": " Internet-enabled counterparts. ", "exact": "If the online readers took notes on paper, however, the negative effects of Internet access were significantly reduced.", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2015-09-02T20:15:34.642790+00:00", "text": "This is something I will certainly keep in mind for my future students.", "tags": ["#psutheory", "psutheory"], "updated": "2015-09-02T20:32:55.232131+00:00", "id": "EwoRUqnSQku1e8ExQVUNbw", "uri": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "permissions": {"delete": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "update": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"], "read": ["group:__world__"], "admin": ["acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is"]}, "user_info": {"display_name": null}, "links": {"incontext": "https://hyp.is/EwoRUqnSQku1e8ExQVUNbw/www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "json": "https://hypothes.is/api/annotations/EwoRUqnSQku1e8ExQVUNbw", "html": "https://hypothes.is/a/EwoRUqnSQku1e8ExQVUNbw"}, "user": "acct:CalamityWrites@hypothes.is", "document": {"title": ["Being a Better Online Reader - The New Yorker"]}, "group": "__world__", "flagged": false, "hidden": false, "consumer": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", "target": [{"source": "http://www.newyorker.com/science/maria-konnikova/being-a-better-online-reader", "selector": [{"conformsTo": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3236", "value": "articleBody", "type": "FragmentSelector"}, {"startContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[9]", "startOffset": 540, "endContainer": "/div[3]/div[3]/div[2]/article[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[9]", "endOffset": 787, "type": "RangeSelector"}, {"start": 10024, "type": "TextPositionSelector", "end": 10271}, {"suffix": "\u201cIn reading on paper, you may ha", "prefix": "late to good reading on-screen. ", "exact": "The students do not only differ in their abilities and preferences; they also need different sorts of training to excel at each medium. The online world, she argues, may require students to exercise much greater self-control than a physical book. ", "type": "TextQuoteSelector"}]}]}, {"created": "2015-09-02T20:13:17.922101+00:00", "text": "I can believe this. It's also difficult during discussions to find a line or quote quickly to share when using an ereader, as opposed to a paperback.
